Reviews.Title: “Hix Island House/Spectacular Compound!”
Reviews.Author: rrlovestotravel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from our trip to both the "Big Island" of Puerto Rico and its beautiful neighboring island Vieques. We stayed for two nights in the Redonda loft at Hix House. This property is truly amazing and boasts spectacular views of the ocean from the hillside that it is located in central Vieques. The architecture is really unique, concrete modern style lofts that are all open air. I will say you should use the bug spray that they provide though the mosquitos are something fierce in those parts. You can hear the rainforest come alive around 5:00 am, which was a unique experience for me. All of the staff was very friendly and gracious. Every day our loft was stocked with fresh eggs, fruit, bread, coffee and juices. All you need to start your day, of lounging by their poolside or hitting the local beaches. I really did not want to leave this beautiful hideaway. Kudos to the Hix Island House.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place...”
Reviews.Author: hartfordtraveler1992
Reviews.Content: Hix Island House is a one of a kind place to stay, I highly recommend it. It's on a quiet hill in Vieques. There are three buildings with guest rooms, one designed with a circle in mind (Redonda), another with a triangle (Triangular), and another with a square/rectangle (Rectangular). We stayed in the Redonda, it was really amazing, like no other place I've stayed. In terms of the space, it's entirely concrete with architect-designed furniture. The bunker-like architecture blurs the line between inside and outside. There are large "windows" (they're so large, calling them "windows" isn't entirely accurate, one of them was about the size of a movie theater screen) but there are no screens. So you will see lizards in your room. We found one on a shirt in our closet when we were packing up to leave. They particularly come out at night, especially if have lights on. They're innocuous though, and not so many in number that we felt even remotely close to overwhelmed by them, quite the contrary, they enhanced the experience by amplifying the tropical setting. We also noticed a bird that took a liking to our kitchen, and we found it snooping around our dining area on occasion. The bathroom in our unit was outdoors, vine covered, with a view of the Vieques hills. We found a little tree frog and a millipede climbing around the vines in our outdoor shower. All of these animals enhanced our experience, though I mention it because I realize this type of setting may not be everyone's cup of tea. The climate inside our unit was comfortable no matter what time of day. We did not really have any bug issues -- maybe some ants and mosquitos here and there (and I'm pretty sure the same bird I saw in our kitchen was nibbling on the soap in our bathroom throughout our stay) but nothing that made the experience any less amazing. Hix Island house is a quiet place, and unless you go there with a bunch of people (which would probably be really fun, will keep that idea in mind), you'll likely go to bed early, but you won't mind. The front desk at the Island House has remarkably friendly and helpful staff. They have great insight into what to do on the island, and where to eat, and they will arrange reservations for you if you ask them. They also have boogie boards, masks, snorkels etc. at the front desk that you can borrow, and the rooms come with portable beach chairs and a small cooler that you can take to the beach with you. I won't go into detail about the architecture at Hix. Suffice it to say it's really amazing and unique (including the pool, and all of the Hix-designed buildings). If you don't mind being a little closer to nature and the elements than you usually are (albeit in a luxurious kind of way), you aren't looking for a place with a late, on-site, night life, and you love minimalist eco-conscious architecture, then there is no place on Vieques other than Hix that you should consider staying.

Reviews.Title: “architecture and landscape paradise”
Reviews.Author: EMUarch
Reviews.Content: we went for our honeymoon and it was great! beautiful yet simple architecture, funtional yet design oriented! an architects paradise! we were invited to the Casona for a cocktail for guests given by John Hix himself and his wife Neeva. They were very friendly and kind. This type of hotel is what Vieques needs! If you want something special, different, romantic and green, I definetely recomend it!

Reviews.Title: “Hix Never Disappoints!”
Reviews.Author: Joe R
Reviews.Content: A few days ago we returned from Vieques - our favorite vacation spot. The accomodations at Hix are a very big part of what makes the island so special for us. We've been to the island many times and have always stayed at Hix. The setting, the landscaping, the architecture, the solitude, and the minimalist approach to hospitality make it unique. Bob, the manager, works very hard to maintain the ambiance at this hillside retreat. He and his staff, Joanne, Liz and Sarah, went the extra mile to make our stay another memorable one. Joe and Theresa, Falls Church, VA.

Reviews.Title: “Different is the word”
Reviews.Author: Plumbus
Reviews.Content: OK so I stayed here and never got around to writing a review. I think most reviewers have done an excellent job describing what this place offers and what it doesn't. Having stated that, I feel there are certain things that should be pointed out: 1. Kitchen utensils and other appliances should be clean and in decent condition 2. Rooms and particularly bathrooms should be clean and properly maintained 3. BBQ grills should be cleaned after the previous guest 4. Privacy is not an excuse to allow rooms to become filthy Aside from the above mentioned the hotel does provide a very nice non A/C, tropical, candle light experience. We just wish it would have included the hotel side to it, were stuff is clean and well maintained and the toilet doesn't look or smell like one at a bar.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing, and expensive for what you get.”
Reviews.Author: Summertravelers_05
Reviews.Content: Our experience here was pretty negative, but even if we hadn't had poor service I think we would have been disappointed. The pictures I saw on their website were, in my opinion, misleading; they show rooms that are much more clean and bright than what you actually get. In reality, the room we stayed in was dark for most of the day and there were lots of mosquitos. I also found a Tarantual under my shoes one morning, which I actually thought was pretty cool, but it scared the heck out of me. Due to a flight delay, we were unable to make it to the island for our first night at Hix. We called ahead and were told that this would not be a problem and I was lead to believe that we would not be charged for missing that night. However, when we arrived, we were informed that there was "nothing they could do" and we would be charged. Fortunately, we were able to re-arrange our plans and ended up staying an extra night at no charge. So in the end, this part worked out fine and we appreciated the management's flexibility. After checking in and showering, we noticed that the shower was not draining. The water backed up and flooded the entire room. We used a bunch of towels to clean up what we could, then stopped by the office to report the incident as we went out for the evening. They assured us that it would be taken care of right away. Great! When we returned almost 4 hours later, there were still towels and water all over the floor so I called the number for the manager, which is listed in every room. Nobody answered. We wanted to shower (we had done the biobay tour), but didn't want to flood everything again, so we went to bed and left it for the morning. When I talked to the front desk the next day, I was told that the shower was fixed, so I went to check it. Indeed, they had fixed the shower, but had not bothered to let us know and they had done nothing to clean up the mess throughout the room. We informed the front desk of this, but even when we returned at the end of the second day, the sopping towels were still in our room and there were more and more mosquitos from all the standing water. The free bread is nice and we really liked that they provide some fruit and eggs every day, but these small luxuries do not make up for the inadequate service and poor room conditions. We picked this place BECAUSE we like eco-lodging in general, but for the price of these rooms I just expect more (better furniture, nicer kitchen equipment, better lighting, but most of all, better service). I understand that things go wrong, and that is fine, but I don't really want to hear excuses about it. Things do go wrong, and at a well organized, high-end establishment, the problem is taken care of right away and you can feel good about it. Hix House just isn't one of those places.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale nature holiday”
Reviews.Author: waynem1
Reviews.Content: We spent almost 2 weeks at Hix Island House and slept like babies the whole time. Waking each morning to a wide screen view (9 ft. x 22 ft.) of the tree tops and ocean beyond with the sun rising over the ocean. The rooms and associated private terraces are very large and fully open air, wherein that wide screen view is your non glazed window to the world. The non glazing is a bit weird at first as you keep wanting to close something across the opening or pull down hurricane shutters. Give it a day and you will come to love this open air concept. We may have been the only guests who did the whole 2 weeks on good quality mountain bikes we reserved through Blackbeard Sports. We only saw 2 other people on bikes during our rides. Car drivers gave us lots of clearance and they drive quite slow. Bikes are not for the faint hearted though as Hix Island House is at the upper area of the mountain range that runs along the island and everything is pretty much down hill from there and a trek on the return. We shopped daily for food with backpacks and bikes in either Isabelle II or in Esperanza. However if you do the same be prepared for the hill climbs of your life to get back to Hix. Most folks rent jeeps, but I don't think they enjoyed the beautiful pool at Hix as much as we did after our rides. The breakfast supplies provided by Hix were excellent and a great start to the day. Beaches we visited had no one on them and the one we found with people had just 24 people on a 2 km white sand beach. Hats off to all at Hix for making ours a most memorable stay. We are definitively going back! Wayne from Ottawa

Reviews.Title: “Different, smart, very relaxing and amazing arquitecture, very private and you can admire all nature's gifts and be confortable”
Reviews.Author: Kavani
Reviews.Content: The management is great, every loft has its special thing, i have never seen a place like the Hix Island house, the home made bread is amazing ( with almonds baked inside yummy!) and when you wake up its beatiful!! From your bed you can see the sun shining between the leaves of the trees, its just wonderfull...:D The arquitecture is smart, practical, different and Green!!! Its a very relaxing and romantic place and you feel you have the whole land for yourselves... I defenitely recomend it! If u live in a city and want to get away from all the noise and stress this would be a perfect place.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it.”
Reviews.Author: rowingman
Reviews.Content: Not for the ESPN watching, bring me drinks by the pool to thumping music crowd, or the beach scene (for that, see the W). The staff were great, it is INCREDIBLY quiet and private, yoga classes were great. I did get munched by mosquitos, but that was from leaving the door open one night so my fault (we were in La Casita, which actually has doors and screens, no mosquito nets over the bed). Never saw the maid, or the bread delivery. It just happened when we weren't there. Very unobtrusive and wonderful. Never ran into another guest, except at the office. Dark at night, stars were out. Frette linens, great toiletries, wonderful yoga and massage, bread, fruit, juices were great. Quiet, relaxing, stars at night, outdoor shower. The antidote to the everyday. Loved it. Thank you Hix Island.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven... can't wait to come back”
Reviews.Author: Klausenheimer
Reviews.Content: Ok, all you downers out there... yes this place has bugs. It's on an island, in a remote location. Grow a back bone! If a little bug doesn't bother you, this place is incredible. The staff is incredible and helpful, the place is over the top unique. The pool is beautiful! I wasn't 100% in love with Vieques, but I would come back just to stay at the Hix House again. If you want a 5 star resort, this isn't for you. If you want a place that is peaceful, where you are left alone to wander and enjoy the great outdoors, then you will fall in love with this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Unique Experience”
Reviews.Author: cabana77
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the newly built Solaris house in February 2012 and loved it. Very clean and completely off the grid. Solaris has private front and back patios, stocked kitchen, semi enclosed outdoor shower and a beautiful view of the bay. We found the staff to be very helpful and friendly. They recommended a bunch of great places to eat, spots on the island to watch the best sunsets, directions to the most amazing beaches in the Caribbean, arranged kayak rentals and our bio bay tour. We also borrowed snorkeling gear, chairs and umbrellas at the front desk for beach trips which really came in handy. Hix is a very tranquil and unique place to stay. We would recommend it to anyone looking for a peaceful island get away.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Place - Do not go!!!”
Reviews.Author: bek22
Reviews.Content: We went for our honeymoon and had to change hotels because Hix was so awful. First, the staff are very cold and unhelpful - not what you would expect for the prices they charge. Second, you better not stay up after the sun goes down because you will experience a total bug attack. Hix is on a tropical island so it is quite warm and there was no breeze when we stayed. The windows have no screens, so what this means is that when you keep you lights on after the sun goes down a huge array of insects will descend on you in your room. This happened to us on our first night and all we could do was sit on the bed under the mosquito net while insects small to humongous landed on the net weighing it down so much that we had to periodically shake the net to get them off. So gross and definitely not a good set-up for romance. We decided we could not stay and told the hotel staff what had happened. They wanted to charge us for the 3 subsequent nights we had reserved the room for even though we would not be staying there those three nights, it was not the high season, and there was only one other couple staying at the time. They also let us know that we should have used bug spray. Thanks! But I don't think that would have done the trick. If we had known that it was more like camping than staying in a hotel we could have made a decision as to whether we were up for that or not on our honeymoon. But when you are paying over $400 for a room, I expect excellent service and to be able to relax in my room after dark. It felt like a total scam.

Reviews.Title: “What Can I Say?”
Reviews.Author: Madison_WITraveler
Reviews.Content: What can I say? This place is truly unique in a way that words can't describe. We stayed here for a romantic and much-needed rest. We love it so much I hesitated to write a review because I want to keep Hix Island House " our little secret".

Reviews.Title: “Incredible place to stay! Can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: Kelanze
Reviews.Content: I can't imagine staying anywhere else on Vieques. The property and our room were spectacular. My husband is a tad less adventurous and had concerns about no A/C and the mosquitos - he loved the experience and we had no issues with either. We traveled with our 20 year daughter on break from school. She was floored by the space - just loved it. The island, and the inn, are both wonderful places to disconnect and just enjoy nature and each other. Very private property; staff was quiet and unobtrusive but very helpful when asked. All three of us hope to make a return visit sometime soon.

Reviews.Title: “for the architecture, its fantastic”
Reviews.Author: jenniferam
Reviews.Content: this place is rather unusual as far as hotels go. i would describe it as an eco retreat. The experience is so relaxing. i went on honeymoon and have never felt so "disconnected" in the best possible way. no tv, no radio, real peace and quit. enjoy the people you are with, sit on a hammock (but not in the noisy, manufactured experience you find at other hotels), listen to birds, feel a warm breeze. This isn't on the water, and doesn't give an island vibe in the normal sense, but really was a spectacular experience. I will never regret this experience. We stayed in Casa rodonda, in the large room. loved the breakfast, again- making your own food from the wonderful goodies they left is not the typical hotel experience, but was exactly what we were seeking. highly recommend!! also, we stayed in dec 2010 but i can't enter that date below. The service staff is totally hidden and out of the way... thats the experience you get here. But you have everything you need. if you want to be waited on, pampered and have luxurious traditional high end hotel experiences with high tech gadgetry, i'm sure this is NOT the place for you. but if you want an off the beaten track experience, and to really be part of a natural environment in a way we often aren't you will enjoy this.

Reviews.Title: “Very unique, wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Boynehausen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here after staying at EvaMer for a couple nights ( which we also loved). Hix is definitely worth checking out, so unique and beautiful. And the daily fresh fruits, bread, stocked kitchen and yoga were added bonuses. Had a great stay, but wouldn't recommend it to people who would be turned off by lizards and bugs in the room. It wasn't dirty but open air doors and windows tend to let in lots of creatures. Also, I was surprised by how much privacy we had with all this open space.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer K
Reviews.Content: Hix Island House is more than a hotel stay, it is an experience- the freshly stocked kitchen each morning, serene pool, outdoor shower and indoor/outdoor living concept which allows you to watch the sunset from bed and look at the stars from the sitting area make this hotel in a class of its own. It has an extremely beatiful and peaceful setting. The staff of this hotel is excellent and work to ensure that you have a wonderful experience. I'm already thinking about when I can get back to this fantastic place!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hix Island House”
Reviews.Author: Maggie_Derby
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a fabulous stay at Hix Island House. We stayed in Loft 7 (top floor of Retangular) and could not have asked for a better experience. We loved the architecture, the freedom of indoor/outdoor living, the sounds and sites from our loft in all directions and being able to lay out on our deck and look up at the stars at night, just a few feet from our bed. Part of the architecture is designed for "getting away from it all" and having a very different experience that life in the big city. This is exactly the experience we wanted and received. Hix Island House is not for everyone - it is very private, and there's no pampering (there's a new W hotel on the island for that), no tv, phones, etc. (although cell phones/blackberry's work perfectly). We enjoyed making our own breakfast from the fresh bread, eggs, etc provided each morning and taking a dip in the pool. We didn't take part in the yoga each morning, but it looked inviting for all levels. We felt safe and had enough access to hotel staff during the day hours if needed. We'd recommend getting your own jeep or four wheel drive to check out beaches all over the island or to be able to go to town for dinner, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! - We Loved the Exquisite Setting (But It's Not for Everyone)”
Reviews.Author: Andrew1234
Reviews.Content: Summary: wife and I loved our two nights' stay in Hix House's exquisitely windowless settings; we thoroughly enjoyed the sights and sounds (especially at night) of the attractive, inventive buildings of Hix House and the private hillside landscape which it occupies. Details: a daytime jaunt in the El Junque rain forest proved to be the perfect bridge between our previous night's stay at a well-coiffed but soulless San Juan resort hotel and two nights in November 2011 in the natural setting of Vieques Island and Hix House. The careful siting of the buildings provides loads of privacy and, quite frankly, it screams for you (for us, anyway) to take off your clothes and relax. I must have used the villa's marvelous outdoor shower three times each day. And when night falls, the symphony of bird cries and insect sounds is exquisite -- ditto for the beautiful sight of moonlight washing over a hillside of tropical trees and plants. I wanted to stay up all night so as not to miss it. Vieques is a pretty undeveloped place, so action is yours to arrange and provide. Hix House lends out snorkels for the beach, and Joanne (cheerful innkeeper) helpfully brokered slots for us on a Mosquito Bay kayaking tour. While at Hix House, we enjoyed cooking our own breakfast in the apartment's well-stocked kitchen. The pool is large enough for meaningful exercise or simply to float. Hix House provides visitors with a naturally beautiful, mellow, and unhurried setting for relaxation and a good base for exploring the low-key attractions which Vieques offers. However, those who seek resort-style action, calendars jammed-packed with recreational events, and chic dining should look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Hix House on Vieques”
Reviews.Author: christne33
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Hix House in three of their suites for a week. Despite previous arrangements to have all of us located in one building, the management switched my husband and I to a room further down the hill. My brother and sister in law were in a suite that was on the bottom floor- it was dark and kind of dank smelling. My mother in law had the best room by far, with a huge circular open window that looked out into the trees. The pool was nice enough, though a bit chilly despite the hot weather outside. I found the location to be mixed- it was nice to see the wild horses in the open fields, but you have to drive to go anywhere- beaches, meals, grocery store- nothing is within walking distance. The rooms themselves were definately rustic. One night when it rained quite hard and if your things are anywhere near the opening in the "wall" then they got soaked. Also, the coral around Vieques was in really poor condition, due to the US military's previous occupation there. Don't get your hopes up for great snorkeling or diving on Vieques. I hear Culebra is much better in this regard.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: IanxB
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 5 nights for our honeymoon. We couldn't haven picked a better place. A car is nice, but if you're not in a hurry you can hire a "publico" and save some money. Our driver was very informed about the island, each ride a mini history lesson. The staff is absolutely amazing, very friendly. Highly recommended, will be returning in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Jungle tranquility and a few uninvited guests”
Reviews.Author: BKLYNTravels74
Reviews.Content: First before booking know that this is not near the beach and you should have 4 wheel drive to get here but it is well worth the out of the way location. When my friends and I stayed we were the only ones on the property which was fantastic but it did get a bit creepy especially when we found a live tarantula in the pool the first night. You must be OK with bugs to stay here as it is an eco resort with no screens in the windows. That said we had a fabuolous time. The place is beautifully designed, set in a gorgeous tropical jungle environment and the freshly baked warm bread you receive each day is not too bad either. Actually we devoured it and it may have been the best thing we ate all week. This place is extremely unique, it is not a place where they will hand hold and pamper you but if you are an adventurous type that appreciates unique design then by all means you will love this place as much as we did. The units are well stocked with everything you could need including beach reading. The front desk can be a bit unreliable but someone new was there so it may not have been the norm.

Reviews.Title: “Wish this place was where I really lived”
Reviews.Author: imjustpassingthru
Reviews.Content: We spent two absolutely wonderful nights at Hix Island House. The room, the whole place actually, was so neat. We loved having it open to the outside, with the breeze blowing in and the lovely views of the Caribbean from the porch. It was also nice to be able to make a yummy breakfast at our leisure and eat in the sunshine while wearing your oh-so-comfy Egyptian cotton shirt. The bed was really comfortable, and the outdoor shower gave gazing up at the stars new meaning. The staff was so friendly and helpful with everything from getting us a ride to town, letting us borrow snorkeling gear, and providing suggestions for a dinner spot. We had a great yoga class in the open-air pavilion. I could barely get myself to fly home. Tip: a car is good to have since this place is in the country, though we biked pretty easily from here to the beaches and Esperanza.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular place”
Reviews.Author: Candidog
Reviews.Content: We loves the concept, design and facilities overall. From the shirts to the breakfast in the room everything was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great, Quiet and Peaceful Retreat in a Tropical Jungle”
Reviews.Author: DrGT
Reviews.Content: Had a great time. Loved Nature and Architecture, great, helpful and relaxed staff!

Reviews.Title: “Indoor Camping In An Idyllic Retreat”
Reviews.Author: roxylass
Reviews.Content: Hix Hotel isn't for everyone, but we loved it! You sleep under a mosquitoe net on comfy beds listening to insects, birds, horses, dogs, and more. Each room has an outdoor seating area, which is a perfect place to enjoy a glass of wine while watching the sunset. It was truly magnificent! Each room is equipped with a small kitchen and fresh bread, along with eggs, jams, coffee, fruit, etc. is delivered daily. The fruit could have been more local and wasn't always refilled, though when we asked we were able to get an extra pineapple. The kitchen was more than adequate for us to cook breakfast and dinner daily. The room as a whole could have been a bit more luxurious for the price and given the marketing, but we really did enjoy it all. And the outdoor shower is fantastic! The yoga pavillion was nice, but not in a particularly beautiful area and I expected there would be a better view of something. Instead you are essentially surrounded by trees and right next to the driveway. The pool was also less than exciting - perfectly fine, but it wasn't enough to tempt me in and the chairs looked a little old. I would definitely go back, but make sure you know what you're getting into - it's not for everyone! And make sure you rent a car immediately upon booking - they sell out quickly on the island!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, secluded, friendly.”
Reviews.Author: carolina78113
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here during our honeymoon. Everyone made us feel very welcome, and went above and beyond in terms of helpfulness (from travel arrangements well in advance of our arrival, to restaurant recommendations during our stay.) The rooms are clean, very private, and had beautiful views of the surrounding land. We loved it---we hope to come back some day! -Caroline & Cornelius

Reviews.Title: “Amazing retreat! Unique experience but not for everyone.”
Reviews.Author: AtlantaJen
Reviews.Content: We stayed in The Studio in Casa Triangular and the room is amazing. But you should know that it is open air, there is no way to close off the room so you are literally in the trees outside. My husband and I went for a quick 4 night/5 day vacation and loved every minute of it. The weather in early March was great, it was cool in the mornings and at night and got up to about 80 F in the afternoons with low humidity. You definitely need to rent a car because the location is not walkable to anything. The beaches in Vieques are absolutely amazing and Hix Island House has beach chairs, a cooler and umbrella for you to take with you. We stopped at the local market and picked up Corona, hummus and pita chips for our beach trips. Many times we were the only people on the beaches since they aren't commercial. Vieques and Hix Island House is fantastic if you're a bit adventurous and want to do something out of the ordinary. I would definitely do it again!

Reviews.Title: “Attentive Architecture In and For Repose”
Reviews.Author: hollygraybill
Reviews.Content: My husband and I felt instantly and serenely welcomed and comfortable settling into our sleek but rustic loft at Hix Island House. We were refreshed by John Hix's attentive architecture with his thoughtful environmental intent. Our private veranda for sunbathing and reading, tradewind breezes from unscreened windows, our private outdoor shower with singing birds, Frette linens, the quiet pool, and the daily delivery of fresh baked bread, eggs and fruit utterly relaxed us. Our response to an inquiry in town as to where we were staying was met with "People either love it or hate it there." Well, we loved it! The opposite could only be the case if you were expecting Club Med's bustle and amenities and if you had not researched to find out what Hix House truly is. It is artful, contemporary conscientiousness in and for repose.

Reviews.Title: “It's Ok”
Reviews.Author: GiacR
Reviews.Content: I am the minority here based on other reviews. I did not think this place was so wonderful. Overall the place is serene and very quiet, which I liked. However, it is just not my type of place, expecially for the price. I should have done more research, but for those who are unsure, here is my experience. There are no screens on the "windows". I get that not having screens is part of the whole ambiance, however since this place is in the woods there were more bugs and spiders than I ever want to deal with in a hotel room or even my own home. I was also disappointed with the breakfast. The fruit was not even tropical. There were apples from Washington. If you are going to be eco, wouldn't you try to get fruit that does not travel so far, especially if the hotel is located in a tropical climate?! The cereal was just plan old corn flakes. The bread was okay, but it was not that great. I also did not like that we were asked to pay for our entire stay upfront. A deposit is one thing, but paying for the entire stay is another. I could have refused, but when you are tired and just want to get somewhere sometimes bad decisions are made. I say this because my husband and I wanted to check out a day early and we were told we would still have to pay for the entire stay. I just complied as I did not feel like having an argument. Although I am almost certain that a hotel cannot charge you for unused services. Lastly, when I expressed my unhappiness with the place, the manager was a bit condecending. Suggesting I am a novice traveler, of which I am not, and that I should just go to the W hotel if I was unhappy. I did not appericiate his inferences. Let me put it this way, if you like camping, this place is for you. In the end I blame myself for not doing enough research.

Reviews.Title: “Peace at last”
Reviews.Author: lisaboy
Reviews.Content: I fell in love with Hix Island House before even getting there. My husband and I were the stereotypical harried couple with three kids and two jobs ready to GET AWAY in a serious manner for our 17th anniversary. We stayed in San Juan for two days and couldn't wait to hop on a plane to take us to Vieques. Hix is unique and recalled several fond memories of places I have stayed as a guest with friends. It is private, nonintrusive and clearly operates on its own peaceful rhythm. It was a rhythm we got in sync with right away. Is it for everyone? No. My husband I and played a game figuring out who we knew who would love it and who couldn't take it. Its concept asks you to let go of lots of preconceptions about what luxury is and what truly constitutes relaxation. We loved the open air room, the open shower, the privacy of the architecture--the quiet of the place and the respectful quietness of other guests. I felt trusted to come and go and make the experience our own. I knew there was help there if I needed it and I felt that everything we could have wanted was supplied. It's a wonderfully conceived place that is not overwrought with concept. It is what it is and it doesn't seek to be anything more. My husband I I honestly reconnected--back to the essence of who we were when we first got married. Making breakfast with the eggs that are provided and toast on the grill pan all became a fun part of the process. Even grinding our own coffee and using the French press was fun for us. (Yeah, we reall ydid need ot get away!). I loved it here. We did yoga our second morning and loved that as well. The pool is lovely, too. A highlight of our whole trip was being invited to cocktails (with all other guests) at John and Neeva's Hix's resplendant house. They could not have been more gracious. We couldn't stop talking about it. Thanks to everyone for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “forget the W”
Reviews.Author: travelerXYZ_1234
Reviews.Content: an overall quality experience: -practical, well designed architecture enhanced the experience. -staff very accessible, helpful, friendly -daily yoga a huge perk. wish Maureen was there more. (she's excellent, and a trained instructor) -housekeeping was consistent and reliable -wish it was more eco and sustainable with amenities: (stocked food, bath products, detergents used in their laundry, BUT its GREAT to have a basic kitchen to work with. this saved us mucho dinero and you can make do with the limited staples in the grocery stores. -open air interiors invite more wildlife in: mosquitoes (our net was holey but im sure the staff would have hooked us up with a new one had we said something), roaches, spiders, geckos, beetles and birds. -this was one of our favorite places weve stayed at. the beaches in culebra are better but staying at hix in vieques is a superlative experience, the kind you don't want to advertise too broadly. -if you like resorts you should stay at the W. otherwise, this is the place to come for a quality, restful vacation that truly feels like one.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect quiet escape'”
Reviews.Author: clotn
Reviews.Content: This truly a special place, loved all of it. Lush grounds, fruit trees, hammocks, views and chlorine free pool. Yoga was lovely outside but she could change it up a bit. Building nÃ©w 2 bedroom units.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful, peaceful, and tranquil”
Reviews.Author: mrs_hans
Reviews.Content: First time to Vieques. Traveled with my husband and another couple ( who stayed in a loft next door to us). Was a little apprehensive to stay here knowing that the room was opened to the outside. Definitely worth the experience..... Loved it so much would go back in a heartbeat! Delicious homemade fresh bread replenished daily with fruit, coffee/tea, cereal,milk, and juice stocked in the refridgerator. All the amenties of home with the exception of the t.v. radio, and computer ( I think wi fi is availabe if you wanted access- fyi didn't miss it at all) Extremely quiet and peaceful but only 10 minutes to downtown area if you want places to eat,shop or experience some nightlife. The beaches are unbelievable. Many of the beaches have so few people you feel like you are the only one there! We rented a car and you definitely need one to get around the Island. The food was absolutely amazing however cost more than expected/budgeted. We had planned to eat cheaply for lunch at the Sol Food truck ( which had great reviews). Unfortunately they were closed the days we were in Vieques so we traveled back to town for lunch.. When we return, our plan is to get some food at the grocery store and stock the fridge with lunch items. Great trip/ great experience- One of the best places we've traveled to and will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Hix Island House is a luxury hotel of a different kind”
Reviews.Author: maryH084
Reviews.Content: Hix Island house on Vieques Island, PR, offers an unusual luxury - space and openness to the surrounding subtropical forest, the sounds of birds and other animals. it offers the luxury of comfort knowing you are minimizing your use of resources and maximizing your gifts to the environment. In most hotel rooms you are surrounded by stuff packed into a small space. At Hix you have what you need. Hix is a challenge to your ideas about hotels - it is more like a sanctuary or a temple to the earth. Beds are great. Mosquito nets were a new experience but it worked out. there's solar heated (somewhat) pool. Hix is like Vieques - all about the outdoors- it allows you to experience it completely.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing....!”
Reviews.Author: JCG_MA
Reviews.Content: The place is a total relaxing experience. Although there is some construction going on onsite so be aware that nap time during the day will not take place until the construction is done. Love the place and concept. Bed was very comfortable, clean friendly and amazing setup. The only down side is that since the rooms (concept) is all open and you have someone staying on the room next door and is not aware how drunk they are and they start talking, laughing at 2:00am, you will be getting woken up by. The place is so quiet that you can hear yourself thinking (love that.) My point is that, maybe guests need to be informed that when coming in late, be aware that they are not the only ones on site! Other wise, love love love the place! Oh make sure you rent a car because Vieques is bigger than expected!

Reviews.Title: “Our 4th visit to Hix- will go again”
Reviews.Author: JimBarrington
Reviews.Content: Hix is probably not for everyone. If you don't like golf courses, resorts, cruise ships or crowds, Hix is for you. If you want to get away from it all, enjoy peace and quiet in a natural setting, Hix is for you. Hix Island House is a bit like camping without any of the hardships. You're outdoors but need not get wet. You have a wonderful hot shower when you want. A great bed. Nice linens and amenities. A full kitchen. Yet, you sleep to the sounds of frogs. Watch the birds. Feel the breezes. It is a zen like place to escape and do nothing or do many things. It is camping in total luxury. Vieques is a great out of the way treasure in the caribbean and Hix is the jewel in the center of it all.

Reviews.Title: “Why stay anywhere else?”
Reviews.Author: GandK0504
Reviews.Content: My partner keeps saying this is the â€œbest hotel in the worldâ€�. I cannot recommend this place enough. It's a nice mix of luxury and rusticity. The staff were friendly and helpful but not intrusive. It was great to sleep with open windows under a mosquito net. The daily fresh baked bread delivery is a nice touch, as is the kitchen stocked with eggs, milk, juice, fruit, jam, and a Brita! We had dinner at the new W Hotel and I was so glad we weren't staying there: it looked really nice but at the same time totally generic. Comparatively, staying at Hix Island House is a truly unique experience. The property is designed intelligently and consciously; it's both hip and highly functional. It felt good to support a place that is making a concerted effort to reduce, reuse, and recycle. They offer an authentic Puerto Rican dinner prepared by a lady who lives nearby. We were looking forward to this but found out she was unavailable because she was preparing for Three Kings Day. It sounded delicious: pork chops, rice with pigeon peas, I forget what else, $40 for two! Hopefully if you go you can partake in this.

Reviews.Title: “The most relaxing vacation ever!”
Reviews.Author: JMWnvt
Reviews.Content: My two sons, their wives and I spent five fabulous days at Hix Island House in January. We stayed in three lofts, adjorning to mine, the largest, for breakfast and the wind-up of each day. The arrangement gave everyone lots of privacy while enabling us to spend as much or as little time togther as we wanted. Breakfast was especially fun. The guys cooked, and we ate and lounged to our hearts content. Later, they enjoyed the pool and snorkeling, while I read and relished the break from my demanding job. The staff was incredibly helpful, the location was terrific and the wild horses, hummingbirds and other birds added immeasurably to our enjoyment. An A+ experience!!!!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful”
Reviews.Author: mcleod9988
Reviews.Content: Well the Hix House is indeed beautiful. Very private, quiet, romantic. The rooms had fresh fruit, bread, and coffee put in every day. It was almost like a mini-apartment. The lady that works at the front desk was more than helpful helping us find a car for the island, giving us advice on beaches, even lending us board games for our room!

Reviews.Title: “Slow down and enjoy the beauty”
Reviews.Author: Mac60090
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently made our second visit to the Hix Island House in Vieques, PR. The unique design of the buildings offers privacy and openness. If you love to be outdoors you will continue to experience that feeling while in your well appointed space. With a kitchen stocked with the essential things a visitor needs one can manage quite nicely should you choose to hang out for several hours in the morning and early afternoon. The staff at the hotel are warm, helpful and very accommodating. This is an excellent choice for people looking for a high quality, simple retreat.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, relaxing room in the trees”
Reviews.Author: melissarates
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at Hix. The rooms are unique, comfortable and beautiful. I loved waking up and looking out at the trees and hearing the sounds of all the critters in the world around us. All the small details were just right as well: the kitchen was well-stocked with both fresh bread and good-quality dishes and appliances including fiestaware, henckels knives, and All-Clad pots and pans. The towels were soft and it was great that the hotel had beach chairs, umbrellas, snorkels and games to borrow. The one caution I'd give is to just realize this is a very unique hotel experience. If you like plush and standard, this is not for you. And light sleepers could be bothered by the nature sounds, which get quite loud!

Reviews.Title: “In touch with nature.”
Reviews.Author: davilasola
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed every moment of our stay at Hix House. Loved the architecture and waking up witha GREEN view. The sky at night was amazing. Perfect place for couples. We felt at home with the fantastic staff. They provide coolers, beach chairs, snorkling equipment, board games, books...and the best freshly baked bread each morning. I also enjoyed the yoga class and just laying in the hammock watchind the birds and the horses. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “open air island charm”
Reviews.Author: dresdemona
Reviews.Content: We agreed that our stay at Hix was our best hotel experience yet. While I realize itâ€™s not for everyone, the island houseâ€™s architecture and openness made us feel right at home! We woke up to the sunrise over the ocean, and the smell of fresh-pressed coffee. Yoga, massages and a daily re-stocked fridge all added to the experience. I highly recommend Hix if youâ€™re up for an adventure in a peaceful Puerto Rican setting.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: VojVoj
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights at the Hix House at the end of August 2010. I certainly enjoyed the architecture and the concept, and I didn't mind the bugs, too much. But it is not worth the price. We love the island of Vieques and spent some time looking at alternative hotels, and found a few. For example, local people spoke highly of Villa Tamarindo and some mentioned Blue Horizon. Look around: there are better places to stay that will charge less. Also, for 24 hours there was no water at the Hix House. We could not shower, brush our teeth, make coffee, etc. When I asked if we could get a discount, the mangers simple stated that this happens from time to time, so No. I thought that was sort of cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Manage your expectations”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoMan09
Reviews.Content: Manage your expectations We stayed 3 nights and since it appeared we were the only guests at the hotel, they upgraded us to a much better space than we had reserved. We thought the room was really cool, and we loved the windowless view, the geckos and lizards (yes, in the room, but they're as weirded out by you as you are of them), the pool. We were a bit nervous the first night, thinking the bugs would be hovering all around the netting that surrounds the bed, but over the course of our 3 nights, the bugs were a non-issue. Still, it's not 100% relaxing and those tree toads can really make a racket at night. Some downsides? Stained, sandpaper-rough beach towels, one of which was matted with cockleburs. No daily maid service (the hotel says it doesnâ€™t want to "intrude" on your solitude â€“ please, intrude). Our experience there was marred â€“ and I'm being kind â€“ by construction going on right outside our very expensive window, waking us up at 9 one morning and 8:15 another morning (see photo, taken from the room). For all the talk about the serenity of the place, we found very little and even had to flee one day because the construction noise was ridiculously loud. I live right near Wrigley Field in Chicago and itâ€™s quieter. Despite all this, we looked upon the experience staying there as an adventure. And it was. We had a lot of fun.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, Rustic Experience--Truly Unique”
Reviews.Author: WashDCMan
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for something truly different and can handle the unavoidable quirks that go with that, you will love Hix Island House. We stayed here for two nights, in the Triangle House. My wife kept the design of the hotel a secret from me till we arrived. I was floored--in a good way. The room had this huge open wall section that looked out over a large expanse of trees. It felt like a treehouse; I loved it. There were numerous windows with wooden interior shutters, but the one wall was permanently open from about waist up and about 30 feet wide. It was like a Frank Lloyd Wright cabin in the woods. This means that you get a fantastic view of trees, flowers, and hummingbirds. Incredible nighttime sounds of frogs and crickets. And, yes, you also get a few bugs. But the geckos eat most of them. And there's a large, suspended mosquito net for the bed, along with citronella candles--so the bugs aren't a real problem. The kitchen was well stocked: Puerto Rican coffee--if you can't use a French press, here's your chance to learn--great homemade bread, real butter, some jams, a few eggs, single-serve milk boxes. I actually made some very good French toast. The shower was halfway exposed from the waist up--but there's a lot of foliage, and no one can really see you. (The toilet is fully enclosed.) There is no air conditioning--but the ceiling fan works pretty well. The pool is decent-sized and really quite nice. If you want sleek, chic, conventionally luxe, or trendy, this place is not for you; continue to the W Hotel (which we also enjoyed, staying there one night). Likewise if the idea of finding a few bugs on the cement floor or geckos on the walls disturbs you. But if you're wanting a true adventure or if you're a serious architecture buff, you should definitely consider Hix Island. TIP: You will probably want to rent a car--and a couple of the nice ladies who work there will rent you theirs for a good price. (One, Christen, also gives beach tours and is a treasure trove of local info.)

Reviews.Title: “Hix House is not a place to stay”
Reviews.Author: haciendado
Reviews.Content: Spent a week on Vieques and went to every beach and almost every lodging. Went for the beaches. Hix is about as far as you can get from any beach. Not even decent views. The concrete rooms were dark and damp. Do not understand giving a five, unless one's expectations are really low. W has opened, the premier place. Blue Horizon far better than Hix. And the Hix concrete is starting to crack.

Reviews.Title: “Rejuvenates your soul!”
Reviews.Author: antonpog2000
Reviews.Content: My partner and I have been spending our spring vacation in Vieques since 1999. We stayed at Hix during our first visit and though we had a wonderful time we decided to try another place the next year and another for a few years following. Each year we we visited we always talking about what a great time we had at Hix and why we didn't stay there. We decided to try it again several years back and have returned each year since. I found the recent review complaining about mosuitos interesting because Hix is a green resort cooled by the Carribean Tradewinds. There are no paned windows in the rooms, just large expanses of openess, which will mean you'll see bugs - hence the mosiquto netting. Having AC or property foggeds with insecticide just doesn't work with the ethos of this place. It's clean, modern, rustic vibe along with beautiful beaches is all you need on Vieques. Anyone who wants is looking for air conditioning, daily maid service and valet parking should visit another island.

Reviews.Title: “HIX House = Divine & Exquisite Rustic Luxury”
Reviews.Author: socialadvance
Reviews.Content: Our 3 night stay ( March 12-15 2010) at the HIX House was wonderful. The staff is gracious and helpful, grounds are lush and beautiful, and the pool is simply heavenly! Oh and I should mention our Loft was amazing. There is something soothing and magical about falling asleep and awakening to the chirps of coqui-frogs and birds. Although the Hix house is centrally located, you will want to hire for rent a 4X4 vehicle in order to explore the amazing beaches of Vieques for snorkeling, small cliff jumping and floating in the sea ; all of this within 15-30 minutes drive from HIX HOUSE. The town of Esperanza is only a 15 minute drive away; there you can find bbq vendors or sit down to a nice dinner. Since we had a full kitchen in the loft, if we had chosen to we could have easily purchased groceries to make dinners on our own. The eggs, breads, milk and juices made for great breakfasts in the morning and the french press coffee was aromatic and tasty. One evening we opted to use "Jimmy's" catering for a take out roasted chicken, cole-slaw, rice and beans dinner. It was very plentiful, tasty and only ~$20.00! If you love nature, sweeping views, lush grounds, an amazing pool and gentle trade-winds, the HIX house is for you!

Reviews.Title: “We came, we saw, Vieques conquered!”
Reviews.Author: SixBix
Reviews.Content: We came to Vieques in February on a random recommendation by our cousin. Found Hix Island House because the website intrigued us. The experience far exceeded our expectations---we know better than to have high expectations based on a web-site! Staying at the Hix is truly an experience. This is for those who enjoy the simpler, finer things in life while appreciating being in harmony with nature. They provide you with breakfast fixin's, beach chairs, a cooler, the most comfy nightshirts (I HAD to buy one to take home!) and the room was so spacious and well-equipped I could have stayed for a month! Call me a kitchen snob, but having sharp knives, good pots and attractive dishes made cooking in a pleasure! All of that more than compensates for a few mosquito bites. :) What better validation than to say we came back again 5 weeks later!!!! And next winter we'll bring the whole family.

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorite places ever”
Reviews.Author: kumabear
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a loft and it was perfect. This place is a hidden gem, we basically never saw another guest even thought we knew it was pretty full while we were there. Its well kept, simple and very peaceful. If you want full service and no associations with nature, don't come here, you will be disappointed. This place is all about connections with your environment, which is exactly what John Hix had in mind, so just know what you want from a vacation and if you like an eco-friendly place that will drop your pulse and make you forget about your job back home, then come here. We were upgraded which was a very nice gesture, probably was a bit of a pain for them to get the room ready and have us move, but the pay off for Hix House is that I will be back for sure! Beautiful pool and wonderful breakfast treats, and the outdoor shower was the best! This is on my top list of places to stay and I travel a lot!

Reviews.Title: “Burger for price of steak”
Reviews.Author: houstonflounder
Reviews.Content: My wife booked this. I kept quiet until I read in the welcoming literature "You can take the garbage out...." Mosquito city. Our room had no ocean view. Bring a flashlight for when you come back late. They do provide you with mosquito repellent, you will needed. No service. Tired furniture. Old noisy fridge. "Gourmet" snacks at reception: Chips and oreos. There was a plunger and it was put to good use. This is a reminder of the adage "Buyer beware" I don't get the good reviews, my wife was fooled by them.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Hix House Experience”
Reviews.Author: MplsKatz
Reviews.Content: Our 4th stay back to the Hix House was perfect,again. We stayed in our favorite room, the Adobe. We love being surrounded with Banana trees, Palms, Hybiscus and many more tropical trees and shrubs. The rooms are open, yet private, and the view to the ocean is more clear than last year. The Yoga classes are wonderful in the natural setting of the outdoors. The Hix House is all about the eco-experience. Barb & Steve

Reviews.Title: “Another Perfect Week at the Hix House”
Reviews.Author: Mightycat
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I just returned from our annual visit to the Hix House. Like every year before, we loved it. The staff was pleasant and helpful, the rooms were clean, and the pool was beautiful. The bread and other food items provided make it easy to hang out on the property for the entire day without feeling you've missed something from the island experience. Our favorite beaches, Playa Grande, Navio and Blue Beach are easily accessible so our day trips were ideal. After we packed up our belongings at the beach, it's only minutes back to the Hix House property for an outdoor shower, a glass of fruit juice and a nap in our comfortable bed. The views of the ocean from our room and the pool were beautiful. We've already made our reservations for next year.

Reviews.Title: “If you like mosquitos, this is the place to stay”
Reviews.Author: regattas
Reviews.Content: Lured in with the eco-friendly advertisements, we booked this hotel at close to $300/night. they didn't mention that their "architecturally significant" designs brought nature inside....i.e. the mosquitos, moths and other insects. Maybe I'm naive, but i would have thought a hotel in a mosquito infested area of the island, would have screens. I love nature and like listening to the birds in the morning and the crickets at night, an occasional neighing of the local wild horses, i just want screens. Under the auspices of the eco friendly architechural design, the room was dark and it's hard to read or see just about anything in the evenings.

Reviews.Title: “Like having your own island”
Reviews.Author: Greenack
Reviews.Content: La Casita is the ideal room, if you are lucky enough to reserve it. Perfectly private, it is nestled away at the top of a hill, with an amazing view. We loved the details, like amazing towels and robes, and Rusk shampoo and soap. The outdoor shower is the best part, and the patio is a close second. The scents are refreshing and energizing, and the night sounds allow for a peaceful sleep. Loved the pool and the staff, and the coffee and bread that magically appear daily.

Reviews.Title: “Glorified Camping”
Reviews.Author: brookline426
Reviews.Content: Visited Hix for the second time this January. Let's start with the positive: The location is beautiful, the buildings are unique, and the beaches of Vieques are unsurpassed in the United States. That said, many of the staff at Hix are just plain rude, and they do not clean your room on a routine basis. You should also know that there are no screens in the rooms, and it is possible that you will be eaten alive by mosquitos. There will be something wrong with your room - it may be minor, like a kitchen outlet that doesn't work, or something slightly more annoying, such as a safe with no key (although they caution you about leaving items in the room) or a room that has no way of locking at all. When you go to the front desk to mention it, they'll sigh and make it clear that they've known about this issue for some time. Then they'll blame a previous guest, and make it clear that there is not a chance in hell it will be fixed while you're there. Unfortunately, that game is not the most charming in the world. Bottom line: we would go back to Vieques, but we would not return to Hix.

Reviews.Title: “VERY SPECIAL”
Reviews.Author: ccny20
Reviews.Content: all i can say is that it's a very special experience staying at this hotel. the pictures just don't do it justice - you have to experience it. the architecture, landscaping, views, everything is just spectacular. it's so relaxing, very private, and the island itself is fun to explore - beautiful unspoiled beaches with warm crystal clear blue-green water. the concrete buildings not only keep the air inside cool, but you also can't hear your neighbors which i find is really rare in any hotel. the staff is lovely and very helpful, rooms are spacious (even the smallest ones)...i can't say enough good things. you must go!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Paradise”
Reviews.Author: wilsonsumner
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 4 nights during Thanksgiving week. We desperately needed a quiet, relaxing getaway, and Hix Island House fit the bill perfectly. I had read a lot about the resort over the years, so my expectations were very high and we were not disappointed. We stayed in La Casita, which is the guest house attached to the Owner's villa. It was heavenly, very private, with wonderful private terrace and outdoor shower with amazing views and breezes. Bugs weren't really a problem, except for some pesty mosquitos after a rainstorm. Hix provides everything you need for a great breakfast, so you can sleep in and eat whenever you want. The kitchen was fully stocked with everything utensil and equipment you could possibly want.

Reviews.Title: “romantic place”
Reviews.Author: fedora13
Reviews.Content: the most unusual place that we ever stay, unforgetable experience excellent staff defenetly will return

Reviews.Title: “Feeling Conflicted”
Reviews.Author: denverroadtrip
Reviews.Content: There are some great things about this hotel. The pool is perfect- pretty surroundings, great view, unusual shape, long enough to swim laps. It seems like the upstairs lofts are really cool. We needed two beds. The only room w/two beds is The Gallery. This is a rustic room- a simple square shape, two twin beds, some very basic furniture, and unpainted cement floor/ceiling/walls. It got dirty so fast and there's no housekeeping service. The bathroom floor was getting gross by the end of the second day and my friend had to clean the drain. Our room was screened in but the front door had large openings near the floor. We sprayed a circle of raid around the beds an hour before going to sleep, and our poison moat took care of the roaches we found each morning. By the time I saw the second tarantula outside next to the room in the same day (really), this became a real problem. We checked out the next morning for the more civilized but less interesting Tamarindo. Consider these two things. 1) This was a basic room. It's the apparent afterthought of the owner. It should be priced this way. We paid $205/night (w/tax) in the offest of all off-seasons. I can see why some of the lofts cost considerably more, but this was an insult. This room should be priced at $75 in off season, and $125 in season. Maybe add $25 for the pool and service and $25 for the kitchen that was stocked with basic foods each day. 2) We apparently had the only ground level room with a screened forth wall. All rooms have only 3 walls and open to the views- cool, but on the ground floor I can't imagine what walks in after seeing what we dealt with. I loved how helpful Beth and Jo Ann were, but spend top dollar for the perfect room, or don't stay here. What a relationship breaker this easily could be.

Reviews.Title: “Hix House is the ish!”
Reviews.Author: jenna0181
Reviews.Content: I absolutely LOVED it here! Stayed in the Triangle Loft.. Had our own private rooftop sun deck, they brought us fresh fruit, bread and eggs every morning.. Too much to mention. Just loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and relaxing but be prepared for the bugs and wildlife”
Reviews.Author: Chitravel33
Reviews.Content: The buildings and the setting are amazing. We stayed at Hix as a part of our Honeymoon. This is an extremely relaxing and beautiful property. However, you must be prepared to live with nature in all its positives and negatives. I read every review on Hix Island House before we booked and I thought I knew what to expect. Be prepared for the bugs and nature to be part of your life. We stayed in Loft 1, which was beautiful. All of the Lofts have a very Zen design and definitely contribute to a very peaceful atmosphere. But again, be prepared for nature. When we checked in, we were told that there are not very many bugs up where the buildings are situated and we found that to be false. The first night we were invaded by an army of very tiny red ants (not sure if they are fire ants but they sure bite) and we woke up with approximately 100 bites on our bodies. We pulled the sheets back and there were hundreds of ants in the bed. They most certainly were not there when we went to bed as we did a thorough check of the bedding. We immediately informed management and they changed the sheets and sprayed around the room. We also bought numerous types of bug sprays/repellents at the local store in order protect ourselves. We spent approximately 15 minutes before we went to bed the remaining four nights spraying around the area and spraying ourselves with bug spray. (Side note: the mosquito nets do not work well when you use the fans they provide and are very hard to keep the bed covered with the fans blowing them around. Also, be prepared it doesn't really get lower than 78 degrees at night and it is humid. The fans help, but the "trade winds" are not exactly air conditioning. We got used to the temperature after a day or two, but its not exactly cool) We did not have any further problems with the ants. But there are many other bugs/wildlife that will be in your room and you need to know whether you can in fact deal with them or not. It rained several nights of our stay and we did have a ton of mosquitoes in our room. Additionally, we did encounter between 5-10 cockroaches (they are big) in various parts of our room, including the robes hanging in the bathroom. There was also a very large spider in the outdoor shower that literally jumped several feet across the shower when we tried to get it. Helpful tip, make sure you put away any food and definitely check the floor to make sure there are no stray pieces or crumbs, the ants will find it and they will swarm to it and they will bite you. There are variety of lizards that will be on the walls and crawling around the room. They did not bother us at all, they are very unobtrusive and help with bug control. But again, you need to know whether you can deal with them, because they will be there. They are also all around the pool and the property. We also had a few very small frogs in our outdoor shower which was very cool. Overall, the rooms were clean. We did notice the new bed sheet they put on our bed for the last night of our stay was stained fairly significantly. Also, the white robes in the bathroom were stayed yellow in places as was one of the night shirts that they leave for you in the room. I'm sure they take bad linens out of their rotation but these did make it through whatever quality control they have. The pool is wonderful. It is a great temperature and you could literally spend a day just at the pool and your room. It is small, but we only encountered a few wonderful people at the random times while we were down there. We also did Yoga the last three days we were there and it was wonderful. The instructor is very good with all practice levels and made us feel very comfortable. I was a Yoga virgin, but she surely got me hooked. The grounds and ambiance of the setting certainly help magnify the experience. I do not mean to say that the hotel is not wonderful, because it truly is spectacular. Even with the Ant attack, we had an amazing stay. The grounds are well kept. The views from the property are spectacular. All the employees are very nice and more than willing to provide you with helpful advice about the island or give you anything they can to make the stay better. You just need to make sure that this is something you can handle. It will not be like any experience you have ever had. The beaches on the island are truly spectacular. Every beach we went to could be the cover of a travel magazine and the hotel helps by providing lounge chairs, beach towels, a cooler, snorkeling gear, and wave boards. Seriously the beaches are the most beautiful I have ever seen. There was hardly anyone else there and many times we were the only people on the beach for several hours. If you love beaches you will love Vieques. Helpful tips: Rent a Jeep. You will need 4-wheel drive to get to some of the spectacular beaches on Vieques. We used Maritiza's Car Rental and they were very good. They seemed to have the best vehicles on the Island. Be prepared that most of the companies will not give you space tire, you have to call them if you get a flat tire. Some of the beach access roads are very rocky and we got a flat tire at Secret Beach and had to call. MAKE SURE YOU HAVE A CELL PHONE WITH YOU. Its not likely you will encounter another person if you are at one of the secluded beaches. Overall, a beautiful location. I would agree with a lot of other posters that it is really glorified camping. But, the ambiance is wonderful, the rooms are very well designed, and they do provide you with a lot of extras that most places do not. You must be prepared for the bugs and willing do deal with them. We had an amazing Honeymoon and Hix Island House definitely contributed to that. Even with the bug issues, we still enjoyed our time at Hix and will remember our time with fondness.

Reviews.Title: “First impression is great, but the second through twentieth are even better”
Reviews.Author: victor9000
Reviews.Content: A truly inspired property, Hix blends well with the land around it. Open air rooms (and showers) are a little strange at first, but ultimately delightful and rejuvenating. We experienced a private and tranquil couple of days that got better as we became accustomed to the space. Hix provides daily fresh baked bread, eggs, milk, coffee, juice and teas for your room, and making breakfast in their well appointed in-room kitchen each morning as the sun streamed in was one of many highlights. A word of warning to the neat freaks - Hix rooms are open air, and while bugs, dirt and other natural features are rare visitors, they aren't hermetically excluded, so I wouldn't recommend Hix for folks who shudder at the idea of coming into contact with nature.

Reviews.Title: “Chic yet simple getaway- PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: celinam
Reviews.Content: A girlfriend-getaway supreme! Hix was perfect for our beach filled days and chilled out nights. The property is peaceful and privacy seems paramount there. While Hix IS NOT located on a beach, they boast the best pool in Vieques-it IS great! The beaches are about a 10minute drive away, as are most attractions on Vieques. We stayed in Loft 7, the spaces are also open-air (closed doors only to bathroom and front door), and have open-air showers. We are city girls to the bone, but we TOTALLY loved the nature-loving "Eco-chicness" of this place. The rooms were loft-style and minimalist, very modern and just fabulous. Hix offers amenities most places do not, free of charge: beach towels, snorkeling gear, even a cooler-bag tote for food/drink to beach and beach umbrella/chairs. There is no tv or radio so they even offer board games, and books if you need. There are also no full-length mirrors- we stayed in Loft 7. Maid service restocks the fridge every day with fruits, fresh home-made bread, eggs and cereals and juices. Kitchen a french-press coffee maker. No microwave, no oven. Warning: the area around the lofts are VERY dark at night, but there are flashlights in the loft to use, the "'parking" areas are very dark as is most of Vieques at night, be careful, our ditch had to be pulled out a tiny embankment. George, the owner is a phone call away to help, we were very grateful! The staff was friendly and helpful and English speaking; all ex-pats from the States.

Reviews.Title: “A Unique and enjoyable experience”
Reviews.Author: Jplus5
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, as well as our daughter (an architect) and her fiance stayed at Hix House in two separate units (4 & 8) for one night only. We all enjoyed the place immensely and vowed to return for an extended stay. This is the only hotel we have ever been to where we liked staying ....at the hotel during the day. The rooms were very clean, the beds comfortable, the kitchen supply fantastic and the atmosphere very unique. We loved the pool, the showers (the soaps were wonderful) and even the bugs did not bother us. We simply closed the window and the door and slept without using the mosquito net. Yes, I know, some may say that we have misses the whole point, but I was already covered with mosquito bites (got the all in Old San Juan) and had a bad allergic reaction to them. All in all it was a great experience. A very comfortable, rewarding, unique and engaging, experience although quite pricey. Comments: I wish there was a little bit better lighting in the room. The guests in the upstairs unit were noisy, but that could happen anywhere. Yoga was canceled without any notice. The instructor did not show up. Before checking out we had a hard time getting the attention of the young woman who worked at the front desk, in spite of repeated bell ringings.

Reviews.Title: “I just wish it was closer to the West Coast!”
Reviews.Author: calster
Reviews.Content: It was my buddy's birthday and I convinced him to take me up on a trip to Vieques to experience the bioluminescent bay (a must-do while on the island). I also convinced him to stay at the Hix Island House (HIH) as I had read about it in several periodicals. We chose to stay in the Gallery as it is the only room with 2 twin beds. After arrival, the staff said that we could have chosen any of the other larger rooms and they would have set up an Aerobed. The place is striking. Sure, the decor and furniture are sparse, but infinitely adequate for relaxation. Games, books, snorkeling gear are provided as well. I personally loved the open flow of the place. Sleeping with the sounds of the frogs and rain every night was pretty cool. The fan is all you really need to stay cool, even in the day time. True, you will need a car if you stay here, but the island is small. You have a kitchen fully stocked with breakfast items: eggs/butter/jams/coffee/cereal/ orange and pineapple juice/milk/fresh fruit. We bought some vegetables and cheese at the local supermarket and made omelets every morning. Letty brings fresh delicious bread daily. The pool is brilliant. No chlorine (they use an iodized process to keep the pool clean) and just perfect in the steaming afternoons. We got to meet some of the guests while hanging out at the pool. In the high season, apparently there is a social happy hour to meet and greet your hosts and other guests. The staff is so incredibly friendly and most are long time residents of Vieques so can give you great "insider" advice on places to go. We went to a beach that one of the staff recommended and had a half mile stretch of white sand beach to ourselves for an entire morning. Alas, the HIH is on the other side of the continent. If it were closer, I would be going more often.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding peaceful accomodations in Vieques”
Reviews.Author: Peditox
Reviews.Content: The HIx Island House is one of the most wonderful places I have stayed in my world travels. Seycha (at the front desk) was extremely cordial and helpful (she went out of her way to help us with a personal matter). The accomodations were outstanding - simple, ecologically-friendly, but luxurious at the same time. We stayed in Loft 5 - the view of the sunrise was beautiful and the view from our outdoor shower was unique. Vieques was a wonderful island to visit. We discovered many hidden beaches (the Black beach was the hardest to find but one of the most beautiful!)

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on Earth - truly”
Reviews.Author: mirkatz
Reviews.Content: If I could design paradise, it would come pretty close to Hix Island House. Especially if you get to see the infinity pool at the owners' cottage (which is not for public use). Hix is what I would call luxury camping, in that you get the best of the outdoors with very little of the downside. However, if you are the type to get annoyed at a few mosquitoes or tiny ants in the kitchen or bathroom, or having to do a few dishes after using the kitchen, then this may not be the place for you. For me and my husband, though, the simplicity of our stay there brought us to a calmer place, and having to do small tasks like washing a few dishes or taking out the trash helped me to feel more grounded. We chose this place because they offered yoga every day, and both yoga teachers -Jen and Maureen - were fabulous in their own way (they offered Vinyasa and Amrit yoga). The yoga pavilion is a raised platform with no walls and a corrugated roof. The breeze made it feel amazing. It's hard to top practicing with the birds and beautiful foliage all around you. Maureen also gives excellent massages, which you can book through the front desk. It may have been the best massage of my life. After the massage, she was able to give me special attention in yoga class because she knew my strengths and weaknesses. There is no TV, so my husband downloaded some shows and movies, which we watched on his laptop. The beaches in Vieques are beautiful, but the room with its chaise lounges is so relaxing that we didn't feel like we had to leave in order to enjoy our stay, which was that much more relaxing. This is one of my top vacations ever. We spent a week there. Hix staff were so kind as to upgrade our room, possibly because of the length of our stay and the lack of other patrons at the time. One night we were the only guests at Hix. This was not an issue for us, as everyone pretty much keeps to themselves. Another highlight was the cocktail hour at the owners cottage. We met some nice people and dined with another couple. There were many guests and residents from Massachusetts, like us. Another highlight was a 2-hour horseback ride across the Island. Donde and Liz run the rides, and have great horses. I will definitely go back to Hix.

Reviews.Title: “A great getaway for stressed urbanites.”
Reviews.Author: pterminal
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I enjoyed three amazing nights at the Hix Island House from January 16-19. The grounds were so tranquil the entire time, and our Casa Rectangular loft was perfect in every way. The concept of an open-air room didn't fully hit us until that first night we fell asleep to the sounds of leaves and birds with a cool ocean breeze coming through. Also, the morning sun is that much more intense with no window to diffuse its rays. We saw only one mosquito the final night, but the large net hanging above the bed makes a handy fortress. There is also a garage-style hurricane shutter you can lower in times of rain, which we used only once on a chilly night. The kitchen was fully stocked with all the necessary utensils and staples for making breakfast, along with good Puerto Rican coffee and freshly baked bread. The staff was very accommodating, and seemed to carry a happiness about them simply by being in constant contact with this lovely oasis. Our favorite room activities by far were bathing in the private outdoor shower under the stars, and sun worshipping on the raised concrete deck with a nice ocean view. The only problem with the room is the danger of spending all your time there and never getting out to see the island! If time and money allowed, we would have no problem staying at Hix for an extended period of rest and relaxation â€“ say three months, please! My first time in Vieques the year before, I rented a private house and was completely ready to stay there again this time around. However, after staying at the Hix House, I canâ€™t imagine staying anywhere else on my future trips to Vieques. Best, -Kyle Eberle Brooklyn, NY

Reviews.Title: “Stunning, relaxing atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: pftravel
Reviews.Content: Hix Island House deftly and interestingly combines indoor space with outdoors, giving you easy access to tropical trees outside your door/on patio, exotic birds chirping, cool island breezes to lull you asleep and beautiful sunrises to awaken to. Each of the rooms are more like big apartments with a modern minimalist rustic design that although not luxurious, are comfortable. This is a lovely nature retreat in the hills of Vieques, with a friendly and a very helpful staff. Yoga classes and wonderful massages (in your room) are available. It is a distance from the closest town so if you stay here you will need a car. Hix House is a big part of what made our trip so special and relaxing. I would only stay there if I return.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: netty75
Reviews.Content: The Hix House was a beautiful, unique and relaxing experience. We have dubbed it 7 star camping. The breakfasts we made in our own kitchen with the fresh bread and food was great. Very convenient to be provided with beach chairs, towels, bug spray for your day trips to the beach. The pool area is wonderful if you want to relax around the property. The staff is very helpful with anything you may need. I highly recommend the Hix House. Warning: you must enjoy the outdoors and being in nature. I did get bitten quite a bit while on the island. Definitely use the mosquito net over the bed at night.
