Recommendations during your stay in Vieques: Bio Bay tour Restaurant: El Quenepo Rent a car Explore the various secluded beaches Massage in your room (Maureen was excellent) Cape Airline was very reliable - online booking

Reviews.Title: “This Is the Place To Stay For a Quiet Get Away!”
Reviews.Author: wandererNJ
Reviews.Content: I have to admit that I was a little reluctant about this place after reading the descriptions of recycled water and minimalist accommodations. I am up for an adventure but also value cleanliness and comfort! But, this place was fantastic and far exceeded my expectations! We stayed at the Matisse Loft and upon our arrival, I was pleasantly surprised to find that it was spotless, stocked with fruit, eggs, cereal, juice, etc., and had a small kitchen area that was well-equipped to prepare a great breakfast. The loft also had a charcoal grill and lounge chairs on a private sunning area on the roof. Brenda, the woman at the front desk, was eager to help us with anything and everything and took care of all of our reservations -- from dinner to the biobay tour, etc. I would strongly urge anyone going there to: 1) rent a car (we thought we could get by with bikes but you really need a car to get to the secluded beaches); 2) stop by the front desk each morning to chat with Brenda about the local "news" (i.e., by doing this we got a heads up that the restaurant we planned to go to one night had decided not to open and that the ferry was having mechanical problems); 3) travel to/from by plane because the ferries are totally unreliable and the flights are really cheap and much faster. We took a plane there, but had planned to take the ferry back. Even though the ferry was supposedly fixed by then, it never showed up and we had to scramble to try to find a plane at the last minute. Naturally, so did everyone else that had planned to take the ferry so alot of the flights were already full and we almost ended up being stranded there for another night after we had checked out of Hix and had non-refundable reservations in Fajardo. But, I loved the Hix House and would absolutely recommend it for a relaxing respite from the mania of our daily routines and as an alternative to a high-rise mega-resort that has no charm.

Reviews.Title: “Head Over Heels for Hix!!!”
Reviews.Author: bklyn274
Reviews.Content: A friend recommended Hix to my boyfriend as an awesome place for a chill and romantic vacation spot. Once we checked out the Hix website, we were convinced it would be amazing. Our expectations were far exceeded!! First of all, it's breath-taking and beautiful -- the landscape, the architecture, and the peaceful seclusion were just what we wanted. As soon as we arrived we said we would return. We stayed in Loft 1 which is HUGE and beautifully decorated!!! The table could seat 6 and there is a huge open window/ledge overlooking the pool. The outdoor shower is a spectacular addition. The bathroom also has double sinks and very nice Rusk shampoo/conditioner. The hanging bed is a wonderful spot to nap in the sun (and I believe that Loft 1 is the only loft to have one). Our actual bed was the most comfortable thing ever! We were only at Hix for two nights (we seriously considered extending our stay but a wedding party was coming in and we couldn't). Our two nights felt like much, much longer because it's just so relaxing. It's heavenly, really. The kitchen was fully stocked with pots, pans, cups, plates, silverware etc. The fruit/eggs/bread/coffee/juices in our fridge every day were so nice. We went to the Green Market shop to pick up a couple of other things, but otherwise had plenty of food provided for breakfast. We were also appreciative of the use of beach chairs, cooler bags, robes and towels they provided for us. As most other posts say, there are no screens on the doors/windows. We did not have any problems with bugs at all. (We were there in late June.) However, they do provide bug spray and candles if there are bugs and the mosquito net over the bed. You can also close the big window/garage door, if need-be. The pool is breathtaking -- there's a reason it's been voted the Best Pool in Vieques. Brenda, in reception, was wonderfully helpful both before and during our stay. She set up the Bio Bay tour tickets for us (which we highly recommend) and told us about the best restaurant in town - El Quenepo - where we had a delicious and romantic meal! Hi Brenda! Hix is hands-down the most amazing, relaxing spot we've ever been to. It's the perfect escape from the hustle and bustle of work etc. We will definitely return and couldn't recommend it higher!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful getaway”
Reviews.Author: cbking1976
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful time at Hix Island House during Thanksgiving week. The accommodations are amazing, from the stark beauty of the forms to the crystal clean pool. It was our first time in Vieques and we absolutely fell in love with the island. Hix was the perfect place for us to stay; excellent for low-maintenance travelers like us. The kitchen was beautifully appointed with everything we needed to make breakfast in the mornings and the outdoor shower was heavenly. It's not for people who like a high-rise super resort, but for us it fit the bill perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “Hix is a great experience”
Reviews.Author: Susanica
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Loft 1 in the Casa Rodonda in early July, 2008. We had peaceful time and I cannot complain about anything. Our view overlooked trees and the ocean in the distance. The only thing that obstructed our view was the numerous humming birds buzzing in and out the flowering tree that framed the huge open window. The outside shower was relaxing and it was gently laced with a green vine. Overall the room was spacious and clean. Surprisingly bugs were scarce. Basically Hix is a place to enjoy nature and relax. As far as Vieques, I recommend renting a 4 wheel drive and exploring the beaches and towns. Red Beach and Blue Beach were our favorites, but the more popular Sun Bay Beach was beautiful too. I recommend doing the bio bay tour, but make sure to check the moon phase first. The tour guides at Island Adventures were knowledgeable, funny and friendly. When exploring the towns be sure not to leave any valuables unattended. We had a set of snorkel gear stolen. Even with that one incident we felt very safe on Vieques and it was a great experience all around.

Reviews.Title: “Tranquility, peace and harmony”
Reviews.Author: SPK_DK
Reviews.Content: As many have said previously, it's a fantastic place. It's very much a matter of taste, no doubt that Hix is not your standard hotel experience. So I understand why some may find it not to their liking, but if you have a proper understanding of what you're getting, then then disappointments shouldn't be an issue. I've tried to add some items which haven't been covered previously. We came from Hell to Heaven: after a 4-day conference in Fajardo, at El Conquistador, Hix stood out as phenomenal. We (a couple in our early 30's) we're getting nausious, depressed and fed up with the massiveness of El Conquistador, it's thousands of noisy guests, ringing and dinging Casino, and where just happy to get away from it. So Hix, being the exact opposite, was a true blessing. It's true that you will need a car. Book well in advance, as most places are fully booked fast. We ended up getting a car from Raphael at Acevedos Car Rental. A very decent Ford Explorer. The pictures from both the Hix website, as well as from the other reviewers give a good understanding of what it is, but as a lot of the Hix experience is tranquility, it's really hard to catch that in a still photo. The front desk is VERY helpful (we met Bob & Joanne), but don't forget to ask. They're not intrusive in trying to lure your wishes and desires, so just ask if there's anything you need, or something you need help on figuring out. Worst thing that can happen is a no. We stayed at Loft 5 for 3 nights, and then at Loft 1 for 2 nights. Loft 1 is quite a lot bigger, has two sinks in the bathroom, two sinks in the kitchen, a little desk, a hanging mattress by the patio, and in general is a lot more spacious than Loft 5. It's almost too big for two people. Loft 5 was nice, more simple but great as well. A simple square room with kitchen, bed and patio. Both great rooms. No problems with heat, the ceiling fan along with the outside breeze is quite perfect. I could only reach an internet signal while at the front desk, which actually was OK as it forced a bit more relaxation, and less work. We did a Eco Tour with Abes snorkling, doing the mangroves, snorkling, secluded beach and ending off with the Bio Bay. $100/person, lasting from 2 p.m. till approx 8 p.m. A great trip. El Quenepo is great for dinner. On Sundays the BBH serves an excellent brunch. There are two things would make the Hix experience better: firstly, a daily maid service, just to make the bed, clean the dishes etc. would be great. It's not a cheap place, so it wouldn't hurt with that little service. It's actually great and very much in tune with the whole atmosphere that there isn't roomservice etc. etc., but as the room can get messy after 2 or 3 days, it would be nice with a little bit of service. Secondly (and a very minor thing): a toaster in each room. There's fresh bread every day, but some of us like to toast it a bit, if for no other reason than for variation.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: dalideigh
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at this most unusal and pleasant hotel on a most unusual and pleasant island. The accomadations are suburb, the "lofts" and designed for the utmost privacy and the unique architecture only adds to the delightful ambiance. Go and swim in the early morning and late afternoon in their magnificant and, again, unusual pool. A well stocked kitchen provides for an ample breakfast and if desired a good meal can be cooked. We very highly recomend this place.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect escape”
Reviews.Author: diatwo
Reviews.Content: Definately give this place a try! It's a perfect escape from everything. Located in the mountains, but only 10 min from Esperanza and 10-15 min from the beaches, Hix Island House is the most unique place you'll ever sleep. The open air rooms (and outdoor shower!) instantly calm you. You can sit for hours, admiring the natural beauty of the property. Lizards, birds, and other creatures will entertain you. I promise you won't miss TV. I stayed for two nights in the Studio during my honeymoon. Each morning we enjoyed a self-made breakfast of eggs, toast and honey, fruit, and breakfast- all prepared with ingrediants that come standard in your room's refrigerator. The hotel equips you for a day at the beach with beach chairs, beach towels, snorkling equipment, and a cooler bag. Or, simply relax at Hix's pool and enjoy the stunning view of Vieques. Dont' be afraid of the open air. I never had a problem with bugs. There's a misquito net, but really no need to use it. No creature bigger than an adorable small lizard entered the room. And, if you want to feel more secure at night you can close all the windows and pull down a garage type door to close your balcony/big open air window (although that does get a little warm, even with the ceiling fan). Hix Island House is remote and private. There's no big social scene and no restaurants in an easily walkable distance. I stayed at a hotel in the town of Isabel Segunda for four nights and at Hix for two. I found that to be the perfect balance of "town life" and relaxation in the mountains. While Hix is amazing, I'm not sure that I would have wanted to stay for more than 3-4 days.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite hotel of all time”
Reviews.Author: KristinCarlson
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Hix House 3 times over the past 5 years, and it is a wonderful experience. Architecturally, it is beautiful. Conceptually, it is a great Caribbean experience. It is off the beaten track, quiet, secluded, surrounded by tropical flowers and trees. It is open-air (no glass or screens) with enormous panoramic picture window openings. There is a full kitchen in every room, and the staff brings you fresh breakfast supplies every morning (homemade bread, island fruit, fresh coffee for the French press, etc). You will love coming back here and making dinner with your travel partner after a long day exploring the beaches in a run-down jeep. The pool is surrounded by lemon trees and great for a late night swim. The roofless showers in the second floor rooms are amazing under the stars as well. The hotel is eco-friendly, doing things like watering the plants with greywater and using solar power to heat the showers, and does not allow children under 12. It is the perfect romantic escape. This is true to the point that we returned after two fantastic visits to have our wedding here.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: kevart
Reviews.Content: We visited Hix Island House for 10 days in April. We stayed in Matisse, which was beautiful, we really liked the roof top deck. As other reviewers have said, the staff was all helpful, the fresh bread, eggs and coffee a great addition to our stay. We relaxed, did not miss TV or telephones. Luxury camping is a great description. We enjoyed the other guests as well, this is the kind of place that attracts interesting people.

Reviews.Title: “A different....but wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: giggy19
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took a quick trip from New York to Vieques in May and stayed in the Hix House. In past trips to the Caribbean we had stayed mainly in very nice resorts like Caneel Bay in USVI, but this time we were looking for something less expensive, but still not like a big overblown resort. Hix Island House was just as described. It was peaceful, interesting, very in-tune with nature, etc. Within the first minutes of arrival we saw geekos and hummingbirds from our "window" (which is nothing like a real window!) We really enjoyed it despite its minimalist, very casual approach. Vieques too was fun and interesting. Great beaches with virtually no one else on them. Wild horses everywhere. Pretty decent restaurants (we ate twice at the Chez Shack and highly recommend the walk from the Hix House on a starry evening.) We enjoyed the Bio Bay -- it was a little touristy (as far as anything can be touristy in Vieques) but a fascinating natural wonder that we're unlikely to experience anywhere else. With the right expecations, Hix is a wonderful experience. Highly recommended!!! If you have the wrong idea of what it is, however, you might be sadly disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hix Island House & Vieques”
Reviews.Author: LeeBC
Reviews.Content: Hix Island House, Vieques: My wife and I have just returned from what we consider our best vacation â€“ ever. Not enough superlatives to describe Hix Island House and Vieques. The accommodation was perfect for the ultimate getaway. No television, no noise, no windows even - just beautiful and tranquil surroundings and a chance to get away from the maddening crowd. Rat race behind us we could enjoy the architecture of the Hix complex (itâ€™s stunning in an understated way) and the natural landscaping surrounding it from vantage points such as the private patio of our loft, a roof deck, the low-chlorine pool and even a hammock slung between trees in a quiet paddock on the grounds. You feel very much at peace and in a state of permanent relaxation whilst there. We spent a few days just lounging around, enjoying the fresh coffee, bread, and fruit and such that Hix supply to the lofts each day, cooking, reading, napping and simply trying to take in all of the flowers and accompanying wildlife that our loft (Adobe) was nestled within. The open-air shower with a panorama of flowers, trees and fauna was a joy each morning as was waking up with the shutters and doors open to sunrise. We slept under the mosquito nets provided and had no problem whatsoever with bug nuisanceâ€¦ The resident host of small (and cute) Geckos etc. saw to that I think! When we did need anything the staff couldnâ€™t have been more helpful & friendly â€“ If you go, I recommend going to the ownersâ€™ cocktail party â€“ they have a house on the complex with (if possible) even more breathtaking viewsâ€¦ J Crew shot a catalogue at Hix I think â€“ I can see why. As for the rest of the island â€“ unspoiled, laid back and fun. Hire a Jeep (4 wheeler necessary) and explore. 2/3 of the island is a nature reserve and that which is open to â€˜explorersâ€™ will by way of unmade roads and fun in a Jeep take you to secluded/deserted beaches â€“ On the way out to â€˜Green Beachâ€™ we enjoyed two undisturbed days on a small beach (complete with cabana) and not a person in sight. Bio-Bay on a dark night is well worth it (the water glows when agitated) and snorkeling is also good. We enjoyed Chez Shack (a shack come gourmet restaurant) in the middle of the island as well as tapas and sunset at BBH. I could go on â€“ but most of all â€“ it is a complete get away from work-a-day life. Weâ€™ll go back to Hix and enjoy Vieques again. I recommend staying at Hix and getting back to nature, flying from San Juan by charter flight to Vieques rather than trying the ferry and definitely hiring a carâ€¦ Oh and donâ€™t worry about the hire cars â€“ their â€˜Check Engine Lightsâ€™ are all, and always, onâ€¦ Stay at Hix Island House - have a great time!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, relaxing place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: MissyfromMichigan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for 4 nights, in the beginning of March (a few weeks ago). We had a wonderful time! I'll admit that after reading some reviews, I was really concerned about bugs, lizards, etc, but I was really comfortable there. We saw very few bugs, and only a few very tiny lizards. The lizards stayed over near the patio and the entryway, and never came near the bed or closet areas, so they really were not a problem. The Hix Island House is very clean and extremely peaceful. There are no TVs, clocks, radios or internet access within the rooms, which is exactly what we wanted! The staff was very friendly and helpful. The women who worked at the front desk were both great - they gave us directions, recommendations, and helped us by booking a trip to the bio bay. The landscaping around the hotel grounds is gorgeous. We were on the ground level and had flowering bushes surrounding our patio. The hotel is inland, so the view of the ocean was extremely limited, but we still thought we had beautiful scenery. Staying here was a fabulous experience! Sleeping in the fresh air, with the sounds of the birds and the wind, was great! We woke one morning to rain, and loved it - the sound and smell of the rain was a great way to wake up! I would suggest buying groceries and planning to eat in the room for several of your meals (there's a full kitchen). There is only one restaurant that is very nearby, but it was closed when we tried to go there (which was around 5:00 on a weeknight, so they must have irregular hours). The hotel is about a 10-minute drive from the nearest town, which isn't a bad drive but it did become a little tedious when we had to make the drive multiple times each day. One more suggestion is to try to arrive before 5:00 pm. We arrived after dark. We had been told that the office would be closed. As promised, there was an envelope waiting for us, with our name on it, with the key to the room and directions for getting from the office to the room (the office is in a separate building from the 3 buildings that house the rooms). Being completely unfamiliar with the area, we were a little confused by the directions. We did make it to our room (after starting out in the wrong direction, plus I was nervous, thinking I was going to run into a lizard as I was walking around the side of the building to our room), so the directions were correct, but it would have been easier to find our way during the day. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “fabulous, tranquil, relaxing”
Reviews.Author: stillhungry555
Reviews.Content: Most beautiful setting on vieques, super comfortable accommodations, and very efficient little kitchen. The staff was very friendly and accommodating, gave great recommendations for places to shop, eat, and swim, and hosted a weekly cocktail party for guests, which was a great intro. There is a gorgeous outdoor (covered) yoga area, with classes every day, a fab pool, and overall an extremely tranquil atmosphere. They provide an insulated bag for beach picnics, along with beach chairs and beach towels. Some tolerance for wildlife is required--you'll be sleeping under a mosquito netting, and on our trip we saw geckos, lizards, leaf bugs, mongoose, and even a spider. But sleeping with fresh air coming through and to the sounds of crickets, chirps, and cheeps of the jungle was totally a fair trade.

Reviews.Title: “Astonishing property”
Reviews.Author: getaway9
Reviews.Content: Hix Island House by Frequent Caribbean Travelers We've stayed many times in Vieques at another hotel on the Island, but the Inn had a change in ownership, and we wanted to try something different for our return to Vieques for the February get-away. Hix Island House fit the bill. We stayed for ten days in Tiangular House in the Matisse Room. It was fantastic, it was private, our massages were great, the pool was refreshing, and our room was bug free, even though everything is open to the sky! Staff, especially front desk manager Brenda, are the tops. Fresh fruit, juices and baked breads were delivered to our room every day. Weekly cocktail parties at the owners' extraordinary villa gave us a chance to meet the others staying on the compound and hob nob with John Hix and family, the creative inspriation behind Hix Island House. We cooked in the apartment half the time, but got a chance to try out new restaurants on the Island during the rest of the ten days- which was very easy to do since Vieques is such a small island. Our favorite was La Campesena. Vieques is a bit quirky as an island, but what an easy place to get to from the northeast. All in all, the vacation was a value since a 15% discount was offered since we stayed more than a week. Highly recommend if you are interested in something a little different, you want to support an ecco-friendly hotel, and you don't mind being a little isolated from the hum drum of typical resorts.. Jim and Keith

Reviews.Title: “Concrete Paradise Nestled in the Jungle”
Reviews.Author: abhbos
Reviews.Content: All I can say is "wow!" My girlfriend and I just returned from a magical four day stay at Hix. We stayed in the Adobe Loft, which was on the ground floor with a very private patio on which we got massages one afternoon. The trip was one of the most relaxing I have ever had and our stay was a centerpoint for that. The Hix House is actually several different buildings, each with three or four "lofts" constructed of concrete with unglazed windows. Every loft has some form of private outdoor space and many have outdoor showers. The buildings are designed to interface smoothly with the natural surroundings and as a result there are all manner of plant and (small) animal life around. We frequently saw lizards in our room and there was a set of black hummingbirds hard at work pollinating the trees on our patio. At night, the surroundings are pitch black and the only sounds you hear are insects chirping and the wind rushing through trees. The sky is so clear that you can actually see the Milky Way, a rarity for us city-dwellers. The staff were incredibly helpful and friendly. They made good recommendations for beaches for various purposes (reading books, snorkeling, bodysurfing, etc) and restaurants. They had snorkel equipment for us to borrow and a couple of boogie-boards as well. Every day they would stock the fridge with food to prepare for breakfast: local eggs, fresh baked bread, fresh fruit, jam, butter, milk, coffee, etc. We were also able to supplement this with some fruit from the trees on the grounds. Overall, this was one of the best vacation spots I have ever been to. It is not the place for you if you equate luxury with sterility or people pampering you and scuttling about like servants. However, if you want a beautifully designed (my girlfriend is an architect and she can vouch for this), serene place to spend time on Vieques, this is for you. We can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Wabi-Sabi architecture placed in heavenly setting”
Reviews.Author: jlpdx
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a nearly 3 week visit to Puerto Rico, the USVI, and St. Marteen. We stayed in many wonderful places, but by far the best was the Hix Island House. We stayed in the Casita ... the architecure was terrific, the setting wonderful and the staff/owners friendly and helpful (and the fresh eggs and bread they brought us each day for breakfast were wonderful). My wife enjoyed the outdoor yoga classes and we both appreciated the quiet setting (its very rural - be prepared that the only sounds you will hear at night are the sounds of the coqi, the crickets and birds, and the roosters in the morning off in the distance). The gracious owners hosted a small cocktail party at their home on the property and we appreciated the chance to meet them and the other guests and learn more about the unique approach to architecture. The island itself was also a treat - we visited three beautiful beaches on the three days we were there and found ouselves on nearly empty white sand beaches with wonderful snorkeling and kayaking. There are several wonderful restaurants within a 5-10 minute drive. I have already recommended the hotel and the island to my friends and co-workers since my return. Dont miss the chance to visit this wonderful Island and when you do include the Hix Island house on your itenerary.

Reviews.Title: “De-Stress!!!!”
Reviews.Author: cdelcor
Reviews.Content: If you are looking to get away with your sweetheart ,from the hustle and bustle of the big city, this is the place to go! I went to the Hix Island House for the Christmas and New Year's Holiday with my boyfriend. We absolutley loved it! When we arrived we were pleasantly surprised with our room-lofts as they call them. The cement structure makes each room so neat and clean. And the outside shower is to die for! We expecially liked the homemade bread that was waiting for us in our room along with fresh fruit, juice,eggs, coffee and all the fixings. We were really excited with this feature as we both like to get up and have breakfast in our room before heading out for the day. Our loft was very private and we had a great view of the ocean in the far away horizon. We did not take advantage of the bug nets because there were no bugs at night- but it is there if you need it. I especially enjoyed the pool because it has such a natural flare about it. The pool is not huge but it was just the right size for the amount of guests that were staying there all week. There were no battles for chairs or getting up at 6am to put your towel on a "reserved chair". The pool is the perfect place to cool off and read in a quiet setting. The Hix Island house is defintely not your typical "all inclusive" hotel. It is not a food-factory, or day camp! We actually loved trying out all the restaurants in the downtown area. We even decided to stay in one night because you have the luxury of having a full kitchen so you can cook dinner yourself. We Loved this idea as we dine out all the time living in the city. The grocery stores and convenience stores have tons of things to chose from. I was so relaxed when I left the Hix House! We are planning to go back next year!!!! ....We are still talking about the trip and how we miss hearing all the "peepers" at night! I highly recommend this hotel to couples or friends who want to get away for a low maitenence vacation! Ladies- leave your heals at home!

Reviews.Title: “Our stay at Hix House made the trip!”
Reviews.Author: FrankTheThird
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Hix Island House. The room was open-air and it was really great to hear all the frogs and birds during the evenings. We had a mosquito net over the bed and only had problems with bugs at dawn and dusk. The kitchen was well-appointed with a blender, coffee grinder and french press and a gas stove. They stocked it daily with eggs, fresh bread, fruit juice and coffee. We loved getting up in the morning, eating our breakfast and wandering down to the pool. After that it was lunch, hit the beach, and back to the pool for more sun before dinner. The staff (especially Brenda) was extremely helpful and gave us some great recommendations for dinners out. If I go back to Vieques I will definitely stay at Hix House.

Reviews.Title: “Nice setting, but bedbug central”
Reviews.Author: SunL0ver14
Reviews.Content: While we had a wonderful time on Vieques, I don't know that I'd stay at Hix again after our experience. Most of the bugs were avoidable by wearing bug spray all the time - it is open air, so this is a necessity - sleeping under the mosquito netting in the room. However, I was eaten alive by bedbugs, which mosquito netting didn't protect against. When I alerted the staff to this fact, their initial reaction was to do all they could to fix it - they sprayed the room extensively, got new sheets etc since they were full that night. We also got a new room the next day, but it was worse. There was no staff reaction when I alerted them to the same problem in a different room. We did enjoy the decor, feel and atmosphere of the place, but without a guarantee of no bedbugs I wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Haute couture camping”
Reviews.Author: mat10019
Reviews.Content: A week at the Hix House isn't like anything else. The architectural lofts are painstakingly designed and appointed -- full breakfast is in your fridge and every detail is proactively considered. But it's different -- no windows means you're sleeping with stars and nature in view and within earshot; mosquito nets protect you when necessary (which was rare; there weren't many bugs at all). Shower in privacy outdoors and in luxury. The staff is amazing, and can set you up with reservations for the week for restaurants or activities. It's private but communal. This is the type of thing you need to experience every few years to remind you why you're alive. This is for hip adults and people who want to live beyond guest house and not in boring hotels.

Reviews.Title: “The good and the bad about vieques”
Reviews.Author: pastora4
Reviews.Content: This trip to Vieques my friend and I stayed at the Hix Island House, a lover's paradise which is also a B & B. The difference with this B & B is that the guests cook and serve themselves breakfast. The geometrical shapes of the buildings are fascinating and protecting the environment is their mantra. Nestled in the mountains, the terrain is uneven and for the physically fit. Night time provides a heavenly show, I had forgotten about the infinite number of stars and constellations. Driving at night can be scary because of the number of horses and colts on the road. While I was driving, a colt bolted in front of the car and only inches saved us from an accident. The roads are well marked and the people are very friendly and courteous. I would recommend a visit to Vieques and a stay at Hix Island House.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely incredible and worth every penny!”
Reviews.Author: jonesgirl84
Reviews.Content: I donâ€™t even know where to start, honestly, except that from the time you park next to the reception house to the time youâ€™re staring at the incredible view from your loft, your jaw will not have closed, and the only words that will cross your lips are â€œwowâ€� and â€œOh. My. Gosh.â€� Hix truly lived up to everything I thought it would be. Brenda at the desk was so helpful and hooked us up with the Bio Bay tour (Blue Caribe, which I highly recommendâ€”so friendly and amazing), a massage in the loft (heaven), a $30 ginormous Puerto Rican meal that we picked up from their neighbor (it lasted us lunch and dinner and was incredible), and directions to every possible place we could as for. The location is greatâ€”secluded, but still pretty central to anywhere you need to go. Definitely rent a carâ€”we had an SUV from Maritzas, who had good prices and were so easy to work with. They took us to the ferry after we dropped the car off, and didnâ€™t hassle us about anything. The SUV got us pretty much everywhere we needed to go, although there was one time we had to turn around because the road got too bad. We would definitely pay extra and get a Jeep next time, since exploring the beaches was the most fun of everything and I think we would have gone to a couple even more remote ones if we had 4WD. But an SUV was definitely sufficient for almost everything. The Room: the pictures donâ€™t lieâ€”our room was spacious, modern, incredibly hip and surprisingly comfortable. The bed was so soft and the sheets and pillows were heavenly. The outdoor shower was also a great bonus, as the views are amazing. We were in Loft 5, which I personally thought was one of the best ones. All of the views were incredible (you could see the ocean, mountains, forests, and lots of lovely sky) and since we were on the top floor, everything felt very private (although there were only two other couples staying at Hix while we were there, so it was pretty private anyways). The amenities in the room were also greatâ€”plush towels, soft button-down Neeva Gayle shirts, along with robes and all the usual bathroom stuff (if you need a hair dryer, just ask and the front desk will gladly give you one). The kitchen had everything you could possibly need to cook with (pots, pans, dishes, olive oil, hot sauce, salt/pepper, a colander, utensils, knives, coffee grinder, French press), as well as the breakfast items that you could request more of each day by writing down what you need on the clipboard at the front desk: homemade bread (such a great snack, we went through two loaves), an assortment of fruit, eggs, pineapple juice, orange juice, milk, cereal, brita water pitcher, jelly, tea, fresh coffee beans. We picked up some cheese and other stuff from the big supermarket near Isabel Segunda (itâ€™s on the map youâ€™ll get at the front desk) and made omelettes each morning. We also cooked dinner and packed our lunches for our beach day excusions, which worked out wonderfully. Other room amenities: trivial pursuit, Scrabble, chess, bug spray, sunscreen, extra blankets, mosquito-away coils (these worked great, we burned one at each end of the room each night), tealights, lighters, beach towels, beach cooler bag, beach chairsâ€¦.we even borrowed fins from the office on our last day so we could snorkel out to the island in front of Esperanza. The pool at Hix is beautiful and so relaxing, and fit right into the landscape with everything else. Some general Vieques tips: Esperanza is a lot of fun at nightâ€”we went to Bananas (very good food) and Duffyâ€™s (lots of friendly expats hang out here), and walked along the Malecon (boardwalk). Isabel Segunda is fun to sightsee for half a day (the lighthouse, the fort both have beautiful views and fun exhibits), though a little tricky to drive around. The bugs werenâ€™t really an issue at Hix, but we probably helped by only using candles once it got dark so that they werenâ€™t attracted to large amounts of light. The mosquito net for the bed is huge, and doesnâ€™t feel constraining at all (it helps if you tuck the corners under the edges of the bed). Use the mosquito coils and donâ€™t leave food outâ€”obviously Hix is not for everyone (if you want a cheesy resort with planned events, you wonâ€™t find it here), but we felt like we were living in a dream the entire time. Allot most of your time for exploring beachesâ€”there is a breakdown a ways back in one of the previous reviews that gives the best details and locations, so I wonâ€™t try to match that. Our favorite beaches: Playa Navio, Red Beach, Green Beach (4WD definitely helps), Media Luna (for swimming) and Garcia Beach. Also, if youâ€™re up to it and have fins, definitely try to go across to the island in front of Esperanza for snorkelling. Head out in front of where Blue Caribe is and go to the right (southwest) side of the island where all the rocks are. The reef is amazing there (we saw so many incredible fish, nurse sharks, gorgeous coral), though it is a bit of a swim. The conclusion? Weâ€™re definitely going back, and next time weâ€™re bringing friends. This was the perfect place to start our honeymoon, and if youâ€™re even thinking about going to Vieques/Hix, do it. It is worth every penny and is one of the few travel experiences I have had that truly lived up to and exceeded my expectations. Iâ€™ll be dreaming about it for years to come.

Reviews.Title: “A Truly Unique, Amazing Escape!”
Reviews.Author: Hotel_Boy
Reviews.Content: How can you describe the Hix Island House as anything but amazing. For one of the first times in my travels, the hotel lived up to the preconceptions and expectations I had created before my trip. To start, our hosts were Diane, Michael, and Joanne, three of the nicest people on the island as far as I'm concerned. Diane checked us in and led us to our place, Matisse, located in the Triangle House. Along the way, she even picked some fresh lemons and brought them up to the house for us. When you get to your room, there are plenty of windows, but no glass. No Air Con, but an amazing fan. The whole concept of the place is to fit into nature peacefully and disturb it as little as possible. And you honestly get that feel once you set foot in your space. Mosquito nets tastefully hang over the beds (and you're instructed how to use them correctly!), a lovely table with chairs, full kitchen with everything you would need to create your own meals (even some eggs for breakfast and fresh loaves of bread daily!!!), coffee press & beans, etc. The pool area is to die for. Clean water, beautiful views, and many times when you are totally alone! Quite rare at an island resort! I think we even spotted a concrete ping pong table a ways off into the woods. Mr. Hix did an incredible job with the design and execution of his vision. This hotel is NOT for someone looking for a pool boy serving daiquiris, a person with high maintenance needs, or your average tourist. This place is for someone looking to get away and escape. Be alone, without distraction of TV or radios... My point is that you shouldn't stay here if you like staying at a W and having a tub full of pink M&M's on arrival. This is for something looking for a bit more out of their trip than extravagance and excess. I never wanted to leave. I look back at the photos and wish I were still there. I have never felt this way about a hotel before. I want to return again and again! The Island of Vieques is unreal. If you are looking for a spot not burdened with tourists and chain restaurants, and to get a real taste of a Caribbean island, then head here for sure! They have some amazing restaurants: Topico is a fabulous seafood joint that was packed with locals. Puerto Rican's have a saying that loosely translates to "If it is packed with people, then you can be sure it's good"; we also ate at the BBH Hotel. It was modern and elegant, ocean side, and very tasty. It was comparable to a NY City restaurant and was located by the pool of the hotel (the Martiniâ€™s werenâ€™t so hot!). Many beaches are located down long dirt roads often filled with water holes and mud pits. GET A JEEP! It can be an adventure getting to the beach, but once there the solitude is breath taking. (Donâ€™t forget to wash your jeep to avoid fees!) At the recommendation of Diane, one of the managers of the Hix House, we went to Blue beach for some snorkeling. She not only described it to a T, but we even found our way out to a deserted coral reef island. There is a beautiful little beach out there. Amazing! I found it very handy to have someone with me that spoke Spanish fluently. But one thing I noticed is that everyone on the island was very friendly and willing to put up with us Gringos who only know one language.

Reviews.Title: “Lasting impressions”
Reviews.Author: BoqueronAleph
Reviews.Content: Beauty, harmony, style, minimalist luxury and comfort are truly attainable without compromising, intruding on or perverting nature. This is the message eloquently conveyed to us by the Hix Island House. This was our second visit to this unique place and we can categorically state that, at Hix's, we experience the friendliest coexistence of environment and a man made resting habitat : a serious (not grave!) respect and commitment for a genuine conviviality between human nature creativity and the inherent, constant presence of a natural scenery. Now, you may think: Is this vacation place for purists, poetically inclined, eco-minded people? Well, of course these qualities could enhance the enjoyment of Hix's particular ambiance, but then, the ambiance itself offer the conditions for these sensitivities to arise in you. This means rarely encountering invasive "civilization" noises or personnel (the on-site, day to day service crew is literally invisible and privacy, as well as silence seems to be of utmost importance for management). Ahhhâ€¦the blissful, sky open, solar-powered showersâ€¦the good old majestic breezes interpreted by Australian pines leaves hush or bees buzzâ€¦ the sumptuous, intimate poolâ€¦ the undisturbed, window-framed landscape and horizon viewsâ€¦ the birds concerts and rain symphoniesâ€¦ Given. People who travel to special locations are conventionally encouraged by the tourism industry to consider amenities. So let's put amenities in proper perspective. At Hix's, amenities are not only plentiful but, above all, thoughtful. For example, you will get an atypically spacious room (only 13 of them) furnished with artful (and useful!) original accessories of world known designers. Thus, if you open up to the aesthetically pleasing surroundings, you are bound to get in touch with your relaxation responses (a short distance to stress decompression) without excluding basic earthy conveniences. Follow me? Wining and dining has never tasted better (if you look well, in Vieques you can find almost any fine gourmet goods to satisfy a sophisticated palate). And then, you have a very short distance access to some of the most astonishing beaches in the Caribbean to let yourself go. What a treasure! We will definitely return in the future. We want to revisit this small and masterfully designed "hotel" that serves both: humans seeking to rest in solace embedded in natural beauty and nature itself.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Loved HIX”
Reviews.Author: LaBoricuaCubana
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hix Island House for our first trip to Vieques and wedding anniversary. We stayed in Loft 3 which had excellent views and was the perfect size for two people. We loved our private outdoor area and shower. We loved Brenda at the front desk and she even helped us with finding the perfect beaches, restaurants, kayaking trip, and even the flight back to San Juan. Just like the hotel says, it isn't for everyone- I'm not an outdoors type of person but I loved the hotel. Just know to expect some tiny lizards and the expected bugs. Mosquitos were not an issue because of the tradewinds and mosquito netting. We felt totally secluded from the rest of the hotel even though there are no windows. The small kitchen area comes with some basic breakfast goods and home made bread. The rooms also come with all the basics for the beach and even have books and games to borrow. As far as activities in Vieques: We had massages in our room by Kristin which were great and you can not miss the kayaking trip. We've gone to the Bio Bay in Fajardo and the Vieques bay is much brighter. It's not to be missed. We had an excellent dinner at BBH for our anniversary and they gave us a table by the beach. Although the concept was great we were soon eaten by the many mosquitios, minor issue because the food was delicious. I would def. recommend this restaurant. All of the beaches were great except for Green Beach, although the snorkeling was good you can't really lie on the beach for long because of the little gnats that bite incessantly. Vieques is a wondeful vacation destination and we would def. visit them again.

Reviews.Title: “I Heart The Hix House”
Reviews.Author: lirrla19
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I took a week vacation in Puerto Rico, island hopping from the main land to culebra and then vieques. We stayed at 4 hotels on this trip and Hix Island House was by far our favorite. The service was incredible, Brenda (who was amazing, so sweet and helpful) helped get us on a flight to the island when we were having difficulty getting in touch with the airline. She also booked our activities which was a big help since our time in vieques was limited. Easy and relaxing. The room had everything we would need, ingredients for the perfect breakfast, beach gear, beautiful comfortable lounge shirts (designed by John Hix's wife! - we bought one on the way out!) The design of the house, and the proximity to nature made us feel so at peace. We fell in love with the atmosphere, the property is beautiful, the structures are stunning. We cancelled some things and decided to stay an extra night. It was hard to say good bye, but we know we are definitely going back! Hix Island House has set the stage for what we will now look for in our vacations. Thank you Hix!

Reviews.Title: “One of the most romantic place ever”
Reviews.Author: Chrick
Reviews.Content: I have been traveling for years, and I am always looking for this very special and unique place. Vieques is truly one of the last paradise on earth, and the Hix is the perfect hotel to stay while you are there. From the minute you board the small plane in Fajardo, you will realize that this is a very special place you are going to. The Hix is just adding to this fantastic experience. The concept is fabulous, the design and architectures are like anything else. It is very simplistic, but offers all the services you would expect, including a splendid pool and outside - but private - shower! one word of caution, this may not fit everyone as the lack of windows and the wide door opening are inviting for mosquitoes. Our bed had a mosquito net and they provide with mosquito repellents. There's also no a/c, so it can get a bit hot especially in our unit (Adobe) as it is on the lower floor and there's no as much breeze as the upstairs units. But don't let this stopping you. This is a place like nothing else, and if you want to surprise your wife or husband, I don't think you'll find better. I hope you enjoy the place as much as we did!

Reviews.Title: “One of Our Best Island Stays”
Reviews.Author: boopieNewYork
Reviews.Content: One of Our Best Island Stays Ever! Hix Island House was the perfect antidote for the stressful lives we'd been living. We visited in early June and found the lush property to be absolutely beautiful, well maintained and utterly peaceful. From the stunning architecture, to the perfect-sized pool, to the comfortable beds, luxurious linens/robes and the relaxing outdoor shower, everything was so much more than we had hoped for. Even the room amenities were way above (and more thoughtful) than other places we've stayed in the Caribbean. For example, in addition to the usual niceties like aromatic hand soaps and shampoos, our room at Hix also had some surprising and very useful extras: lanterns, bed-side fans, beach chairs/coolers, bug spray and most impressively a well-stocked kitchen. But it was the managers -- Diane and Mike -- that made this vacation one of our best island stays yet. Thanks to their restaurant recommendations and skilled reservation making, we ate extremely well (go to Uva for one of the best island meals you'll ever have) and found gorgeous beaches (Blue Beach for great snorkeling). Without them we would have missed some of the best treasures that Vieques has to offer. We definitely plan to go back!

Reviews.Title: “needs maintenance to meet price range”
Reviews.Author: pontouf
Reviews.Content: While we loved Vieques, and appreciated the concept of the Hix Island House, it is in a price range beyond what it offers. Although it is beautiful, the grounds, pool and lofts are in need of maintenance. Many of the dishes in the kitchenette were dirty, and looked like they were 10 years old. Our white towels and robes had stains on them so we asked for new ones and they were very nice about changing them. All of this would be okay if it was slightly cheaper, but it is one of the most expensive places to stay on the island. Additionally, despite the throw on the bed having a colorful pattern, a stain was still visible on it. The concept is peacefulness so there is no maid service, and if you want anything you have to request it at the front desk which is only open between 9 and 5. This is done out of respect for guests tranquility, but then you are paradoxically charged a service charge on your bill in addition to the normal tax. Again, I overall liked the place and the inside/outside design, but at almost $300 a night it's too expensive for what it is.

Reviews.Title: “We Stayed in the Mattise Room 3/05”
Reviews.Author: Androodle
Reviews.Content: While not for everybody as other posters have said, I felt that our stay at Hix was the best resort experience we have ever had. Did anyone else notice how many times the Mattise room showed up in fashion adverts? regards to all, Andrew

Reviews.Title: “Soak in all that Nature.”
Reviews.Author: shingobingo
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a magnificent five day trip to Vieques. We stayed at the Hix Island House. The room was the 'Adobe Triangular Room'. Even the being on the lower level, showering, watching humming birds dance from lush flower to flower is quite the experience. The windows do not have glass panes, and have wood shutters. it is absolutely raw at its core, so it allows you to engulf the breath-taking surroundings of nature. Echoes of the coqui (the local frog), is absolutely relaxing under the moonlit sky. You can plan all you want, by trying to plan your activities ahead of time. But Brenda at the front desk will gladly help you out with the real deal. She made our trip all the more romantic and exciting with her careful recommendations for dinner, beaches, and the BioBay (which we missed regretfully). Also being a yoga newbie, I couldn't resist taking a class in the morning on the premises. Closing your eyes, breathing and hearing all that nature around you, again...is just amazing. Maybe it's being a city boy, that when I see flowers so rich in color, sounds of birds and coqui, geckos crawling everywhere, and seeing horses in the middle of the road...it's just so exciting. If you want to experience something out of the ordinary, totally relaxed, and absolutely amazing, I highly highly recommend the HIX Island House. The hotel is beautiful, the pool is beautiful, the surroundings are beautiful, and the staff are super friendly. My favorite thing about the HIX is the fresh bread on the kitchen counter, with eggs and fresh fruit in the fridge. Breakfast never tasted so good. Never experienced a vacation as refreshing as this. I will have to do it again soon. An absolute must!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT if you don't like the crowd, BAD if you love pampered luxury”
Reviews.Author: HitoZen
Reviews.Content: My gf and I just returned from a 3-night stay @ HIH (actually, went 3/12-3/15). Overall, a wonderful experience worthy of many return stays. Considering the positive reviews left by other reviewers, I'll just fill in some blanks on HIH/Vieques that may yet have gone unaddressed by others. * Room. We stayed at the Studio in Casa Triangular, which is where John Hix stayed for more than a decade before HIH was turned into a hotel. Diane/Brenda/Joanne basically said this unit was John's favorite. It must be so considering all the pictures of it featured in the book of John's works (autographed versions sell for $20 at the front desk). Now, contrary to the photos you see on the website (as of 3/13/2006), you do not have a full panorama of waters surrounding Vieques. In the units' line of sight stands a huge Mimosa tree. We were not much disappointed since this tradeoff of view (of easily reachable beaches) vs usability (hammocks that sway with the trade winds now tied to the trees) was a worthwhile one. * Accessibility. As any of the hotel staff would tell you, a car is NECESSARY. You can practically drive to anywhere you'd want to go on the island w/i 15 minutes (aside to/from Green Beach, which was not worth the trip given that its isolation and that we allocated 1 day to beach hop / snorkel). We rented a 2007 PT Cruiser convertible (Touring Edition, 2.4L Turbo) from Martineau Car Rental (almost across from Martinuea Resort; walkable). Now, Martineau was to have us picked up from VQS (which was 5 minutes away from it), yet we waited for 30 minutes only to get to Martineau via publico ($3/p). Martineau was kind enough to throw in a 7% discount on the rental, only to overcharge by 34% when I looked at my cc bill. Lesson here is to make sure to save all your receipts and to be VERY thorough when you do the car inspection upon first receiving the car (take photos if you must; we did but only because we like taking photos of everything). If you're a planner like me, you probably tried (and failed) looking for driving maps for Vieques destinations. Turned out HIH front desk will give you the only good and useful driving map of Vieques. There is no need to waste time finding good maps of Vieques online (and MS Streets and Trips '07, iGuidance 3.0, or Garmin City Navigator US v8 won't have anything good either). All you really need is just the one map that Brenda/Joanne will gladly give you. Now, if you want to plan a bit using the computer nonetheless, use wayhoo.com to get the GPS coordinates of some of the locales and enter them into MSST. Unfortunately, we forgot to get the coords for HIH so can't help you there. Nevertheless, everything is accessible enough that this level of planning is not necessary. You will not get lost easily while on Vieques. * Amenities. The unit came with a well stocked fridge. We had coffee, honey, tea bags, a dozen eggs, 4 mini-cans of Lotus brand OJ and 4 mini-cans of pineapple juice, a Brita water jug, and a good assortment of fruits. We drove to the nearby Green Market and bought cheese and ham to make omelettes in the morning. What would have been great is if HIH stocked Coqui Fire hot sauce (locally made; [--]) in the units, as Green Market was all out of it when we went. FYI, you can try many of the flavors at Belly Buttons at Esperanza waterfront, however. Neither Island Steakhouse nor Chez Shack had any. Lastly, the room also came with lotsa books in case you forgot to bring some, as well as a chess set, scrabble, candle-lit lanterns, and bug spray! * Activities. We spent what equated to 2 days in Vieques. In my mind, this was the appropriate amount if you also plan to visit the main island (which we did for 3 days). Having days starting at 8AM (sun rises at 6:45AM) and ending by sundown @ 7PM, this was our trip allocation: * One full day for beach exploration / snorkel / bum. See 'Beaches' for details. * Half day for Abe's all-in-one biobay/kayak/snorkel tour. See "Abe's' for details. * Half day bumming @ HIH * Quarter day driving around getting to know Vieques. See 'Accessibility' above for details. * Abe's Biobay. [--] There's quite a few options from which to choose for bioluminescent bay tour. We picked Abe's because they were the only one to offer an all-in-one option, combining kayaking, snorkeling, mangrove traversing, and biobay swim. A good deal at $90/person, we met at Belly Buttons @ 1PM, stopped by Green Market to get more beverages, and headed off driving to Mosquito Bay to start our kayak trip across the bay into the mangroves. Kayak across the bay was pretty exhausting but definitely worth it if you don't want to just lounge your days away. Be sure to try some mangrove oysters - very salty but delicious. Abe will chuck them for you. After the mangrove tour, we continued to kayak to Novillo Beach - the secluded beach accessible only by kayak. It was there that we snorkeled for about 1.5 hours. Beach dinner by the sunset was large coldcut subs prepared by Belly Buttons with chips and Caprisun. Be sure to feed the 'pet fish' as they're used to being fed around 6:30PM and will follow you wherever you go. We then headed off in the dark back to the bay where we witnessed the truly amazing dinoflagellates sparkle like little diamonds at night. This is one of those experiences that no digicam can ever capture. * Food / restaurants. We cooked our own breakfast everyday during our stay. A little mouse also joined us one morning and it scurried across the unit. No wonder the wonderful homemade bread was stored in a tupperware. For dinner, we dined at Chez Shack for its Monday BBQ grill night with live music ($35/person after-tax, for entree + beer + AYCE salad bar). Be sure to call in advance to reserve seats, though we'd actually recommend Island Steakhouse AYCE BBQ dinner ($35/person after-tax, for pina colada + AYCE entree). Island's tasted better, did not have overly loud music or slow service, and was not as "shacky" feeling. (Island's menu consisted of honey corn bread, pulled pork, chicken, baby back ribs, jalapeÃ±o mashed potatoes, and corn on the cob). * Wireless internet. You can either use the iMac at the front desk (that closes at 5PM), or if try to get some weak signals using the 54Mbps wireless connection from the office. Our unit was farthest away from the office unit yet still managed to stream some internet radio with only minor buffering. I hope HIH would spend $50 and get a signal extender. As my gf called it, I suffered from some minor internet withdrawal. * Weather. During the day, temperature remained in the low 80s for the entire trip. Be sure to put on SPF 50 (we only used 15 and 30) since UV gets through cloudy days almost as well as clear days. At night, there was abs no need for AC as the tradewinds really cooled the unit. The gf had the fan off at one point since she got too cold. Only one instance when it rained one night @ 7:30PM for 10 minutes as we rushed to finished building our sand 'castle'. We wished it'd rain a bit more as we did not hear any coqui songs (though we did manage to capture two coquis in the outdoor shower area!) * Beaches. Below is all the information I gathered while searching for beaches. I did not write some of them but figured to save readers time by aggregating what helped us. Favorite was probably Media Luna since that was where I saw a 4ft Mantaray at 4ft of glistening waters. And the sand was fine enough to build detailed sand castles (which we also did, given that my gf's an architect). I've included GPS coords for your convenience. Overview: [--] snorkel: [--] & [--] All the Beaches on Vieques are dependent on the wind direction on any particular day. If the winds are from the Southeast then the North Coast Beaches will be nicer. If the wind is blowing from the Northeast then head for the South Coast Beaches! Pata Prieto (Secret) Beach - VISITED Â· Take main Camp Garcia road (sign is small but it'll be the only wide opening you see. If you see many houses then you've driven too far up north) Â· Drive for 5 minutes/1.3 miles past Garcia Beach and Playa Caracas (Red Beach) Â· Blue sign says "Pata Prieto Beach" Â· At the Y fork, take right. Â· A total of 3 families were there while we were there 10AM - 12:30PM. Â· For snorkel: on the FAR left side, follow the rocks around and ~100 feet from the edge. there are rock outcroppings there, and the surf can be dangerous. Snorkel here rivalled what we saw at Navillo Beach via Abe's tour. Media Luna (30ft shallow and lined for protection) - VISITED Â· 18.08940, -65.45570 Â· Calmest. We saw mantaray! Â· Supposed to have the most kids but there was a total of 3 families stretched over a mile or so of sand. Bahia de la Chiva (Blue Beach) - VISITED Â· 18.11110, -65.38630 Â· Had the most people (13 groups; mostly non-family) Â· The snorkel was not very good as the water was a bit muggy. Red Beach (Bahia Corcho / Playa Caracas) - VISITED Â· 18.10750, -65.41570 Â· Favorite with locals. Gets crowded. Â· I think we stayed all of 4 minutes here because there was too much dried up sea grass. Sun Bay - VISITED Â· 18.09690, -65.46040 Navio Beach Â· 18.09750 , -65.43880 Â· Most Turquoise, the widest white sand and often the most deserted Â· Only beach with waves (but not good for body surfing) Cayo de Afuera Â· For snorkel: South and West/right/ocean are best Â· Need to swim/kayak here Â· Manatees, nurse sharks, and antler coral! Playa Negrita (black sand) Â· Head towards La Hueca, which is located on the southwestern part of the island. From Esperanza head west, you will pass Casa Vieja Art Gallery on your left, slow down and start looking for a dirt road path on your left. You will see a big boulder on this dirt road. You will be driving towards the edge of a cliff, find a place to park around there. Grab your camera, your sandals, put on some sunscreen and walk down a walkway on your left. You will just walk and walk around the coast until you find the black sand beach. I was extremely desperate to get there, but do take your time, it is a beautiful walk towards the beach. As I mentioned earlier you will have to work your way around rock walls. The bottom of the beach is rocky and can get slippery so please walk around with care. Playa Esperanza (for snorkeling) Â· Right in front of Trade Winds Guesthouse Â· Very easy access for snorkeling Green Beach (for seclusion & snorkel) Â· Take the road all the way to the end where it "Ts" and then go left (it's a pretty rough road) Â· Go all the way to the last "cut out" that leads to the beach. Â· Walk to your right about 90 ~ 120 ft then go in the water (too much sharp coral and "sea porcupines" in front of the cut out). Â· Once in the water swim out about 120 ~ 180 ft and swim to your left. There's a great reef out there and I've seen everything you can see in the water out there: all the fish, turtles, sting rays, manta rays, lobsters, and once a fairly big nurse shark (a couple of years ago).
