Reviews.Title: “We'll be back”
Reviews.Author: emdawg
Reviews.Content: This posting can't possibly express my esteem and admiration for what the folks at Hix Island House have put together, but I'll do my best. First off, it is georgeous. The architecture and layout of the place syncs with the stunning natural beauty of Vieques in a way that somehow suggests harmony over and above the obvious luxury. We'll be going back--I don't think we could stay away even if we wanted to. Regarding the service, I'll say this: If you want to feel completely alone, and not be bothered for any reason whatsoever, they'll accomodate you. However, if you need them for anything, they will be there in spades. We unwittingly booked a room on the busiest weekend of the year and couldn't find a rental car or a scooter or even a bike to get around the island. When we realized this might be a problem, we simply called them and I know they tried to track one down for us every day the week prior to our arrival and had pulled off the impossible by the time we landed. When it came time for us to leave the evening of Easter Sunday, a Hix cartaker came to our door two hours before we were to depart and told us our cab driver was getting soused on the beach and wasn't coming. So they drove us to the airport and refused payment! The folks at Hix don't seem to be about taking your money, though I know they're running a business. Instead, it seems that the quality of your experince, of your vacation, is what matters to them. Like I said, we can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Priviledge of Access Rather Than Amenities = A Mixed Bag”
Reviews.Author: cortado
Reviews.Content: Hix Island House is a destination unto itself. If you're willing to pay for the priviledge of access rather than service or amenities, Hix Island House delivers. The architecture and setting are spare and soothing: one experiences a sense of spaciousness there, inpart because the lofts are so much bigger than any hotel room. My partner and I stayed at the Hix Island House for one week and while we enjoyed our visit--the staff is warm, the setting spectacular-- I think it would have been better if I had known the following: While the linens and the prices charged are high-end, the food provided is basic: Letty is a lovely woman and the bread she bakes is good, not great; the juice was canned; the butter was in pre-packaged pats; the jam was from Smucker's; the milk is Parmalat. Add coffee and fruit to this and that is the sum of what you get. So pack your own treats if you're into having a bigger or better selection than what's offered. (We bought greens and muesli from the healthfood store and milk and other groceries from the large grocery store in Isabel Segunda.) Fancier foods --goat cheese, crackers, fiji water, etc... are available at Hix Island House, at the reception desk, for a typically steep hotel-mini-bar price. I would suggest to the management that this stash of food be offered to guests free of charge. It sounds generous, but I think it's only fair, considering the provisions are quite basic. All the restaurants that we were sent to: Chez Shack, Richard's Cafe, Trade Winds, Mama Sanga's -- sucked. Bright Side: We enjoyed the pool and highly recommend the daily yoga lessons with Jennifer. I would also suggest staying in a loft on the 2nd floor or higher; you'll get more light. Vieques itself is a magical place. The people are proud and friendly. Wild horses roam the island and sometimes it seems there are more horses than people. Visit the bioluminescent bay: it's a wonder. The best beach is Red Beach, but make sure you wear sandals: there are prickers in the sand. It's a nice drive out to Green Beach, but it's better for snorkeling than swimming. The best food is at the road-side stands that are open near Sun Bay beach and in the parking lot in downtown Esperanza on Thursdays-Sundays. Chez shack is fine on grill night, but not worth it otherwise. Go to El Quenepo in Esperanza, it is the best of the high-end restaurants. The best restaurant for creole food is at Shaunaa's in Isabel Segunda.

Reviews.Title: “Great Architecture / Different Experience”
Reviews.Author: diana333
Reviews.Content: The hotel is much what other reviewers described. The staff is incredibly friendly and helpful with reservations. We missed our flight out to Vieques due to our own stupidity (did not realize about the time difference and failed to change our watches to local time). Both the hotel and rental car company (Island) were very helpful since they both close at 5pm and we were arriving at 5:30. Island Rental Car delivered our car to the hotel and our car key and hotel key were left in an envelope on the door of the reception area. Our room was stocked with fruit, eggs, bread and other great food. I was hoping that the fruit would be a little more "local" but for the most part it was fruit that I could have bought at home with the stickers on them (plums, apples, pears, oranges, and lemons). There were not very many bugs, which I think is a seasonal thing. I don't think that I could go to this hotel during the wet, buggy season. The outdoor shower was wonderful. For the most part my husband and I felt like we spent a lot of money to go high class camping. We had to be cautious of turning on lights for too long because we didn't want to attract bugs, and I had to read by candlelight under the mosquito net. Our mosquito net could have used a bit of maintenance. There were holes the size of my fist and others the size of my head that would definitely not keep out bugs. I had to try to strategically cover these up, which became a science. There are also adorable lizards living in the rooms, but don't worry they are great. They eat many of the bugs! Another house guest that you will have are mice. We had at least one mouse living in our stove who would come out at night to eat everything. He took a bite of all of the pieces of fruit in the fruit bowl and ate some candy that I had in a plastic bag on my night table. On our last day we heard a lady above us screaming because she found a mouse in her purse. I guess that is nature for you. The pool was nice and warm. A few of the bulbs were out, which made it a little difficult for night swimming, but overall it was nice to have and generally there were no people at the pool when I was in it. The restaurants around the island are really pricey and not really worth the money. We went to Chez Shak (right down the street from the hotel and highly recommended by hotel staff) and I must say that it was WAY OVERPRICED for what we got. The food was good, but we left starving because the portions were so small. My husband and I had two sodas (we don't drink) and swordfish for me and another fish dish for him. The bill came to about $80 including tip, which for the amount of food we got (tiny thin piece of fish and a little squash) is too expensive. We also ate at Tradewinds (decent), Duffy's for lunch (expensive and owned by the same people as Chez Shak, but okay) and M Bar (expensive and not recommended, my fish was overcooked). Overall, the best food that we had was at an authentic Puerto Rican small restaurant on the side of the road. It was reasonably priced and not the same old food that every other restaurant was serving at high prices. For the beaches, we went to Sun Bay (public beach) - very nice calm beach and can park right at the sand edge, Navio Beach - our favorite because the waves were great fun to play in but a lot of seaweed, Red Beach - small beach with shack like cabanas that fill up early but provide nice shade, Secret Beach - small secluded beach, fun to watch the crabs walking along the sand and Green Beach - rocky beach good for snorkeling only. Hopefully this helps give you some ideas about the hotel and island. The architechture is worth seeing because it is impressive and the breezes are nice. Other hotels on the island are also expensive, so it may be worth it to you to spend a little extra and stay at Hix for the "experience." In the end, I must say that I was a little relieved to get back to my own house and bed without mice and bugs to worry about.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Groodle
Reviews.Content: I have never written a review of anything before, but I had such a fantastic stay at this hotel, I felt compelled. It was just a truly excellent experience: The lush grounds and Zen-like rooms were beyond gorgeous, and the managers (and all the people at the front desk) were extremely helpful. This is the type of place that appeals to specific tastes. In other words, it's not for everyone--you are left alone, there is no TV, maid service is only every few days, there is no bar or restaurant, you take out your own trash, and the rooms are open to the outside, allowing lizards and insects free reign. Still, if you're after a peaceful place, with a great bed, an exhilarating outdoor shower, a well-stocked fridge, a gorgeous view, and lots of privacy, Hix is for you. I just returned a few days ago, but I am already dreaming of returning.

Reviews.Title: “Can't say enough...”
Reviews.Author: 2fromMass
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough to express how incredible my visit to the Hix Island House was. My girlfriend, and I visited the hotel as part of a two-week trip around the Caribbean (other highlights to follow). Vieques and Hix Island House were certainly the crown jewel of our trip! We highly, highly recommend this special placeâ€”not only because of the stunning architecture (created by owner/architect John Hix) and the spectacular hilltop setting, but also because of the superb hospitality provided by resident managers Mike and Diane and their staff. When we were searching for accommodations in Vieques, we were intrigued by the architecture and open air configuration of the hotel, as beautifully presented on their website. I'll admit we had some reservations about the open air experience (bugs, etc.), but when I called the hotel to inquire about availability, co-manager Diane quickly put our concerns to rest when she explained that their are no dangerous bugs and that the beds are protected with mosquito nets. That was a relief! In addition to booking my room, she was also extremely helpful in explaining flight (we ended up taking Cape Air from San Juan International) and SUV rental options and provided me with their cell phone number in case we had any problems in our travels. I took her up on the offer before I even arrived at the hotel. Despite their clear directions, we managed to take a wrong turn on our way to the hotel. Mike, patiently helped us figure out where we were (near the island's main village, Isabella) and guided us to the hotel. Upon arrival, we fell in love with the architecture. I've never been anywhere like it before. The hotel's three main guest buildings (the aptly named Casa Redona, Casa Triangular, and Casa Rectangular) are even more stunning than they appear in the pictures. While we expected to be awed by the architecture, we had underestimated the serenity and natural beauty of the setting. Hix carefully situated the buildings into the hillside in such a way that each provides its handful of units with privacy, yet each are only steps away from the pool, check-in building, and yoga platform. The subtle, yet well maintained landscaping is the icing on the cake. I concur with previous revierws' accolades. The managers and staffâ€”while providing all of the personal service we could ask for (and we did)â€”were never intrusive. In fact, the personal attention was a key reason that our brief visit to Vieques was packed with fond memories. Not only did they guide us to several great meals at the island's restaurants, they told us who to ask for at each one. Of particularly note was nearby Chez Shackâ€”which we, following Diane's recommendation, we reached via a spectacular moonlit walk. The restaurant's friendly staff (yes, it is a shack, but with one of the island's top chefs), were particularly attentive when we told them that the Hix House had sent us. Mike helped us with our reservation to explore bioluminescent Mosquito Bay (a Vieques-must-do) and directions to many of the island's secluded beachesâ€”including our favorite, Blue Beach. The staff was consistently friendly and all seemed to genuinely enjoy their work. JoAnne was a wealth of information about the island. A final noteâ€¦the managers' 3-year old standard poodle, Porter, was a particular joy for my girlfriend, as he reminded her of her childhood dog. He reminded us why we went to the Carribean in the first placeâ€¦to play! We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS as usual”
Reviews.Author: L_F_WDC
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd stay in two years at Hix during the Christmas holidays. Last year was so incredible we invited my partner's mother to experience Hix with us this year and Diane & Michael and the rest of the staff at Hix didn't disappoint! Hix is a gorgeously designed property with a very zen aesthetic. For those who love nature as well as simple, modern design you may think you've died and gone to heaven. Besides the architecture we love having a kitchen in our room stocked with the essential food items needed for breakfast (lunch & dinner have been known to happen!). We've travelled all over the world and plan to make this special retreat our winter escape every year from now on! It's our home away from home. I'm already looking forward to our stay next December! Thx. L & K in D.C.

Reviews.Title: “A unique and serene place, Hix Island House”
Reviews.Author: jazzaffi
Reviews.Content: Our fourth trip to Vieques was once again at the Hix Island House. No, we can't get tired of the warm hospitality and peaceful nature of the place. This time, we brought Charlie's two daughters with us. They are both of college age. And they both loved it. It is a wonderful alternative to any other hotel experience. It is luxurious and spartan at the same time. The units have stocked kitchens and ample common space. The luxury linens are always clean and replenished as needed. No one comes to knock on the door daily to say "housekeeping!" which has always irked me. Nor does anyone slip into the units unless requested. Warm homemade bread greets you as you arrive and other basic staples are available such as coffee beans, coffee grinder, French press, and all the accessory items for a nice cup of tea too. I could go on and on but I would do the place no justice. It is a MUST DO for any visitor to Vieques. Brenda, the receptionist extraordinaire was wonderful from the time of contemplation of vacation times and unit availability to the very end of our stay. Her perpetual sincere concern was always accompanied by an infectious smile or an outright grin. She was able to anticipate our needs without being overbearing. The new managers are nice and omnipresent. They were constantly offering to book engagements for us, however, we were unable to lead such an organized schedule. John and Neeva Gayle, thank you once again for having us at your sanctum santorum! No one can come close to what you've created here.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxation and Beauty”
Reviews.Author: Sciencenerd
Reviews.Content: We visited Vieques last year, came to Hix House to take yoga classes and decided to stay at Hix this year. It was a great decision. I was put off at first by the prices but after hemming and hawing, we bit the bullet. What a GREAT decision. My husband and I and our 16 year old son stayed here for a week, did yoga everyday, absolutely loved the living space, cooked our own incredible meals, ate delicious fresh-from-the-oven bread and soaked up the stars at night. If you're looking for relaxation, beauty, peace, quiet, back-to-nature architecture, this is the place. Also, there is a new chef at Chez Shack, a short walk down the road, and he is absolutely fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “amazing”
Reviews.Author: burlboo
Reviews.Content: I am amazed as how Hix Island House is. I am a city girl as well as my husband i was so glad that i stayed there. I enjoyed the pool the grounds the quietness and the tranquility that hix island House brings. As we checked in everything was great we was greeted by brenda the receptionist and she is the best of the best she new where to go and the best restruants on the island. She is the person to talk to for directions anywhere on the island and gave us everything that we needed in hand. The rooms are great it's like you are camping only with a roof on top. But you have your kitchen and you get breakfast you wake up with a cool breeze that enters your room and my husband just loved it. Obvisouly there are mosquitoes and bugs but you are in nature and that's was nature all about. Especially with the getgos in your room they are amazing as well. I will definitely be back to Hix Island House, and i will be making plans soon.

Reviews.Title: “On a scale of 1 - 10: 11”
Reviews.Author: Adeliamisskitty
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hix Island house, La Casita, for 5 nights during Thanksgiving weekend which includes our anniversary. It was the best vacation we've ever had. The following items contributed: 1. The architecture. The concrete building material, the design (high ceilings, clean lines) greatly contributed to our feeling of well-being. It was like being at the newly renovated Museum of Modern Art in New York - no matter where you were in the unit, the visual impact was perfect. The bathroom and outdoor shower area was a dream. The space always looked great no matter how cluttered it got when we left clothes on the ledge and chairs and shoes (sometimes muddy) on the floor. The space is "good for your mind." 2. The comfort. The bed was great and bed linens wonderful as were the towels, robes and beach blankets. We loved Neeva Gayle's big shirts (and bought 2 black ones to bring home with us. I'm wearing mine right now). The kitchen was designed and appointed extremely well - well enough that we cooked all our breakfasts and 3 out of 5 dinners there (and sat under the stars on our patio and ate them with chilled bottles of Chilean red wine). We made sandwiches with the wonderful freshly baked bread for lunch (we grilled it first, it was good cold-grilled) and took them to the beach a couple of times together with some of the generous amounts of fruit that they provide (upon request). We also used the great beach chairs one day and sat at Sun Bay Beach for 3 hours. 3. The environment. It was, indeed, very romantic. You felt like you were one with nature and we often just sat outdoors on our ocean view patio quietly listening to the sounds and breathing the beautiful, jasmine scented air. The only time of day when it was too hot and bright to be on the patio was during lunch and then we would bring the small dining table and chairs indoors, close to the door opening, and have our lunch in the cool bunker-like indoor environment, with the door wide open. The shower, as I mentioned, was heavenly with a full ocean view and a wide ledge where you could place your cooling drink (i.e. a late afternoon beer) while you showered. The pool was divine - very low in chemicals and beautifully designed. I was there early every morning for my exercise and there was never anybody else there. We also took a wonderful, romantic evening swim one night under the stars (pool is open until 11pm). 4. Very importantly: the people who own the place and the staff who work there. John Hix, the architect, is a genious (sorry to embarrass you John). His wife Neeva Gayle, is also a genious. They are absolutely great, caring, people and we feel like our lives are richer for having met them. In my opinion the item "service" includes the philosophy behind the place and my husband and I love the philosophy behind the Hix Island House: nature can't be controlled and the best way to enjoy nature on your vacation is to be close to it, not sealed off from it. Here you are close to it in a beautiful, comfortable environment. All the people we met who worked there: Diane, Brenda, Joan, were absolutely wonderful and helped us with everything we asked for - made reservations, replenished our room, gave us directions. As far as the replenishing is concerned, that's what made it such a great value for us because we got as much fruit and bread as we asked for and that accounts for a large part of our diet (we brought our own oats for oatmeal in the morning). They also provide eggs, milk, jelly, juices and even olive oil that we used for cooking. We made fried rice one night with the eggs. The lemons that grow on the property are wonderful to put in your cold water or beer. To everybody who hates bugs - I have researched the issue plus I know from my sister's experience from 20 years in Puerto Rico that there are no "killer" bugs in the Caribbean. Even scorpions and tarantulas are harmless. Remember, we are a FAR greater danger to them and their environment than they are to us. They may cause skin irritations but that's about all. I always bring Lanacain or something to sooth bug bites. We should all just enjoy every last little creature 'cause who knows how long we'll all be around at the rate that we humans are destroying our shared environment. All those little creatures are part of the chain - they all serve a purpose. Why can't we ever get that into our heads? The last Caribbean vacation we took last February our cottage was full of bugs and we just reminded ourselves of that and felt very calm about it. To sum it up: we intend to go back to the Hix Island House as much as we can and we would like to try all of the units eventually.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic 25th anniversary at Hix!”
Reviews.Author: RItraveller
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 3 nights at HIH and we could not have had a better experience. We only wished that we could have stayed longer. We were celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary and found HIH to be a sensual, romantic experience in every way. Everything starts with the design of the rooms and grounds. Our room (Loft 1) was designed so that the natural world was always present. Whether it was the sun reflecting off the brushed concrete wall in the morning or the fabulous night sky viewed from our outdoor shower, we were never far from nature. The rooms are designed to take advantage of prevailing breezes to cool the room so that there is no need for air-conditioning. This allows you to hear the coqui at night, the birds in the morning or the breeze rustling through the leaves in the tree outside the bedroom window. Yes there are occasional insects, but we used the candle powered lanterns and mosquito netting at night and had absolutely no problems. The amenities in the room were perfect. The kitchen was well equipped and we could have easily entertained several guests. We made breakfast in our kitchen each morning which saved time and money. The homemade brown nut bread was delicious toasted on the griddle. The bed was comfortable with plenty of pillows and the swinging bed on the deck was a nice touch. The grounds are beautiful, but not in a manicured formal garden sort of way. There are at least two trees with small lemons which can be used in drinks, etc. The pool uses a filtration system that minimizes the use of chemicals. The water is clean, warm and relaxing as you float under the palms. We arrived after 5PM on a Friday and there was no one else around so we had the pool to ourselves. It was a great way to unwind after a long day of traveling. Swimming at night under a sky with a million stars was magical. The staff (Michael, Diane, Brenda and Joanne) was friendly and helpful. They provided recommendations answered questions (the biobay trip is an incredible experience which should not be missed) and but did not intrude on our solitude. The masseuse they recommended (Lee) was excellent. Honor system beers and cold drinks at the front desk were a nice convenience. Despite our enthusiasm, I agree with other reviews in that HIH isnâ€™t for everyone. You are exposed to nature in ways that just donâ€™t exist at most other hotels. If you are open to a different but wonderful experience, be prepared for one of the most romantic experiences of your life.

Reviews.Title: “Not Very Service Oriented”
Reviews.Author: missmaggie
Reviews.Content: The architecture and property site are quite unique, however I think the price is too high for what you get. The front desk is only open from 8 to 5 (unless the managers decide to close early for the day). If you need anything when the office is closed, you call a manager on their cell phone and wait. If you need additional supplies after the first day (shampoo, soap, etc), you need to stop by the front desk and request it. Daily maid service is provided at an extra charge, so if you make coffee and breakfast in the morning, be prepared to clean up quick or the bugs get to it. The rooms are starting to get a bit run down; there is mold in the outdoor shower, rust stains in and on the refrigerator, the fan was out of balance and squeaked all night and there were missing light bulbs. Also keep in mind, while there is visual privacy in most of the units, the openness results in little sound privacy. All in all, I think for my $245/night, I am looking for a bit more of a service-oriented hotel versus one that just relies on a it's architectural appeal.

Reviews.Title: “Hix = Vieques. Tranquility.”
Reviews.Author: paulieg19
Reviews.Content: I signed up on TripAdvisor specifically to give a favorable review of the experience my wife & I had at Hix (we stayed in early March - I'm a slacker...). My wife and I were at our mental limits and had to get away, but I demanded some place "different" because I travel frequently for my job so I've grown numb to 5-star hotels/resorts, which all look & feel the same to me. I just wanted peace & quiet, away from people being paid to be nice to me. My wife, on the other hand, freely admits she likes to be pampered on vacations; but she "compromised" for this trip because I was particularly burnt out. Surprisingly, she was absolutely blown away by Hix. Not surprisingly, so was I. Recalling the trip afterwards, we agreed that one of the most memorable moments (along with BioBay, the great food downtown, having the Vieques beaches all to ourselves) was our initial shock opening the door to our room. It was huge, and beautiful in its minimalism. There was one reviewer who used the word "sterile" - wrong. "Minimalist" is a genuine compliment, as the Hix perfectly melds with the overall experience of Vieques. This is an island with only 10k people owning just 40% of the land; the electricity still occasionally goes out - for the whole island. Hix lets you quietly melt into the background and fully experience the tranquility of Vieques. Our view was gorgeous. An obligatory photo of the outdoor shower. Our room was huge. The bread & fruit was tasty, and the fridge a great option. And the outdoor yoga was by far the best yoga I've ever had; fresh air, rising sun, day heating up (good for flexibility). I highly recommend going to the Green Store for lunch picnics and grabbing the occasional breakfast or dinner materials. We went to another store and found worms in our pancake mix. We also swatted some small gnats at night when we played Scrabble (they have several board games downstairs). These things do not ruin a trip; they're part of the experience of an island that miraculously remains one of the best kept travel secrets. The best part of the trip was the lack of TV, computer, or any other electronic/media distraction. We tore thru books, we had a blast & a few fights playing Scrabble, and we had the unusual experience of just being with each other with no distractions. If that sounds boring, don't go to Vieques or Hix. If you want to go to an island for a fake getaway with self-important people dressed in $100 'casual' shorts - go to Nantucket. If you want to relax unencumbered with your loved one on the most unique vacation you two will take, fly or boat to Vieques and stay at Hix. It was our favorite getaway yet (and we travel *a lot*), and wouldn't have been the same if we hadn't stayed at Hix.

Reviews.Title: “Pay attention to your instincts”
Reviews.Author: cpmt
Reviews.Content: While planning our honeymoon in Vieques, I insisted that at least two nights be spent at Hix Island House. It seemed perfect for usâ€”tranquility, privacy, nature, and beautiful design. The first afternoon was great. Brenda was helpful and quickly made reservations for dinner at Chez Shack and a bio bay tour the next day. We spent a few hours lounging by the pool after the beach and then had wine, cheese and crackers in our â€œroomâ€� (the studio). Lizards sunned themselves on our balcony and birds flew in and out. It was very peaceful and unlike anything weâ€™d ever done before. However, the night changed everything. It would have been too dark and steep to walk back from nearby Chez Shack, so we had to drive. Bugs flitted around us as we played scrabble by candlelight. It rained on and off and was very hot, despite the overhead fan. I tossed and turned and only slept a few hours for fear of disturbing the mosquito net and getting eaten alive while we slept. The next morning we tried to make French toast with the homemade bread, while fighting off a combination of mosquitos, flies, rain, and powerful wind. (Iâ€™m sure this would have been easier had it not been the rainy season.) I felt guilty admitting to my husband that I hadnâ€™t done enough soul searching and that Hix wasnâ€™t what I had expected. Luckily, he was sweet enough to make everything okay. He talked to the ladies at the reception desk and they were sympathetic. They refunded us 75% of the second nightâ€™s stay and we checked into Hacienda Tamarindoâ€”a place that isnâ€™t stylish or cool, but our room had an amazing view of the ocean, private balcony and the option of keeping out most of the bugs. Although it was an interesting experience being at Hix, I wouldnâ€™t call it romantic, because it was very difficult to relax. Although I did love camping as a kid, it wasnâ€™t the right experience for our honeymoon. I know there are MANY others out there who love Hix and Iâ€™m not trying to contradict themâ€”simply giving our take. I hope this helps those out there planning similar trips!

Reviews.Title: “Back in Chicago . . . and homesick for Hix”
Reviews.Author: skatterbraind
Reviews.Content: The descriptions posted by other travelers of this hotel are pretty spot-on, for the most part. The design is stunning, the views are incredible, and the staff is so attentive to your needs. My wife (we just got married down in Vieques, and had our reception at the Casona) and I can't pay enough compliments to the managers, Diane and Michael, and our personal "answer girl," Brenda. We've never felt choked up about checking out of a hotel, but this time, it was like saying goodbye to old friends . . . these three were our family in Vieques, and we're really going to miss them. Brenda, always cheerful, always helpful, will get you sorted on what to do and where to go when you're on this beautifully sleepy little island. In the weeks leading up to our trip, she was my point of contact for making sure everything was in order. On top of that, she helped serve food at our reception (more on that later), and our guests paid compliment after compliment on how much they loved Brenda. Michael saved our reception from dissolving into an evening of sit and stare. Unfortunately, a few of our 'party' guests dropped out at the last second, and we were left with an unhealthy mix of old and young that was hesitant to sit back and enjoy themselves. Mike played DJ for a bit and had the salsa going, and although people still refused to dance (my feet hurt/I'm tired/etc), Mike and Diane were dancing, and eventually a limbo stick popped out, and I ended up in the pool in my wedding pants. More people followed (some forcibly) and the mood loosened after that. ---- On a side note, while I didn't get a chance to try any, Mike won a hot sauce competition this past weekend, so be sure to ask him for a taste . . . I've gotta ask him to send us a bottle . . . As for Diane . . . working with Brenda, she made the entire trip as seamless as possible; she made sure we had chicken for the dinner the night before the wedding, she got the flowers to us in time for the ceremony, she softened the blows of 'wedding planning disasters' I encountered -- we could not have pulled off this wedding without her. It's rather rare to meet someone who's a genuinely kind person -- who's not just smiling because she has to. We feel fortunate to have had the opportunity to meet her and this Hix family. The hotel itself is astounding. We were lucky enough to rent out the whole hotel for our wedding guests, so we got to experience each of the lofts. Thunderstorms in your room, coqui (tree frogs native to PR) on your kitchen counter, lizards on your patio furniture, outdoor showers -- all very, very cool. The view from the 'skydeck' of Matisse, I believe (top of Casa Triangular), is beyond words. I'd never seen the Milky Way outside of pictures and the occasional trip to the Adler Planetarium here in Chicago -- on a clear night, the stars are right there with you. If you're worried about mosquitos, yes, you'll get a few bites, but so did couples that were staying in typical Inns and resorts on the island. Honestly, we got more mosquito bites eating at Island Steakhouse (awesome food!) than we did from eating in our loft. Put on some spray and you'll be fine. We had a bit of . . . uh . . . 'naked time,' and the bugs respected our privacy. I'd recommend staying in one of the upper lofts; we stayed in Loft 1 and loved it, but again, we were able to check out the other lofts as well since our guests were basically in every room. The upper lofts were nicer than the lower lofts if only because they had better views. For the love of God, though, if you're squeamish about bugs or lizards or creatures that go 'coqui' in the night, stay at Martineau Bay or something. The reviews that have been posted thus far are accurate, for the most part (admittedly, I was a little nervous about reading nothing but glowing reviews, and paid more attention to the negative than the positive comments). The person complaining about not getting bread -- there's a food request sheet at the front desk, we got everything we wanted every time we requested it. Write what you want down before 1:00 or something, and you'll get it, simple as that. We had zero problems in that regard. Sorry about the rambling nature of this review; we're still in a bit of a whirlwind from everything. While in Vieques, check out Sun Bay, Blue Beach, Red Beach, go snorkeling off Mosquito Pier and check out some starfish, eat at Island Steakhouse and Tradewinds, have a drink at Inn on the Blue Horizon, feed the horses around Hix some mangos, watch a sunset at the gringo bar in Isabelle Segunda (something Mar, I can't remember), say hey to Owen from Casa de Amistad (really cool guy), stop in for a chat with Tom at Tom's Flowers in Esperanza (also a really nice guy, did our flowers and went through hell trying to make it back from his vacation, kinduva funny story), and send Brenda, Michael (ask for some music recommendations), and Diane regards from Bernadette and Mike -- a couple of newlyweds enchanted by our experience in Vieques. We'll most definitely be back, if only just to say hello to some of the nicest people we've met in a very long time. Oh! And stay away from Martineau Car Rental if you can! Our Jeep sucked!

Reviews.Title: “Grain of salt..”
Reviews.Author: bdogmama
Reviews.Content: Yes, believe the reviews...Hix is all that, and more. But be realistic about your expectations. There are no windows and you are exposed. I was shocked to find out that I thought Hix was a little too "one with nature" for my comfort level (I thought I would be down with the bugs and rain) but in actuality found it much more camping than luxury hotel. Don't get me wrong, it is architecturally striking, environmentally friendly and a retreat from technology and the mundane routine. But it's not for everyone (and i'm not exactly a "princess" type). It just didn't live up to it's expectations once I arrived...and we didn't get daily fresh baked bread...we got one for the week. The owners were nice...enough...but not overly so (we met them once). I guess we'd heard all the hype about how wonderful Hix was and were a little disappointed it didn't live up to it. Something about being surrounded by concrete was rather disconcerting, almost sterile. The view was okay, we thought we would have a view of the ocean from our room. The furniture is actually very patio furniture like (in fairness the accessories were unique and wonderful), they have to be durable because yes, it will rain in your living room (and it makes the concrete slippery). We arrived in the beginning of rainy season and the bugs were bad - very bad. But my husband never got bitten. Our mosquito net told a story in the morning...I was afraid to do yoga - something about the combo of deet, sweat and bugs - which I had really been looking forward to as part of our trip. Turns out it was cancelled frequently anyway. The lizards are a novelty in the beginning but we grew tired of them all over our kitchen along with other friends with 4 and 8 legs. Bugs aside...If you're traveling to Hix, here are my suggestions: Bring books for the daytime, maybe even your computer (I know, I know...) for the DVD player with some movies for the evening. Split up your time (if you have it) to really experience the different flavors of the island - the areas are very different (Isabella, Bravo Beach, Esperanza) and Hix is somewhat isolated in more of a hilltop area. Good for privacy and solitude, not if you want to be closer to the action (restaurants, beaches, etc...especially at night). There are many beautiful places to stay on the island. Check out as many restaurants as you can! Of course I don't want to make it seem horrible. All of the things other writers have mentioned - I loved the oversized nightshirts, they provided books and games and the shower was hot. But for the price you pay it's not a luxury hotel as much as an eco-B & B or camping for architect buffs...

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed with a few friends at the Hix Island House over Memorial Day weekend, and must emphatically say that it was one of the best vacations I have ever had. If you are turned off, as I am, by the crowded, souvenir-shop infested, overpriced, commercial tourist traps that so much of the Caribbean has become, then you will love the unspoiled, natural beauty of this island and the elegant simplicity of this hotel. It takes about a day to fully appreciate the genius of the inn's architecture; when I first walked into my room I didn't quite get the huge open-air window cutouts and the polished concrete that makes up the countertops, floors, and walls of the buildings. However, the rooms are designed so that the gentle breeze is constant, eliminating the need for air conditioning, and it seemed almost miraculous that concrete could feel so comfortable and rooms so completely open to the outdoors could be so private (because of the way the buildings are situated on the slope.) And nothing feels better than taking an open-air (but totally private) shower. We stayed in a room called the Studio, and it had a nice kitchen stocked with fresh bread, coffee, juice, milk, and everything we needed, so we didn't need to leave our room until we were ready to go exploring. I spent long mornings reading on our terrace, listening to the birds singing and the wild horses neighing. The beaches were postcard beautiful and nearly deserted, even the public beach with its restrooms and concession (which served surprisingly good food). If you like driving around, there are many dirt roads leading to remote coastal areas. We also had lunch and dinner in the two tiny towns, Isabel Segundo and Esperanza, and the food was excellent wherever we went. The highlight of the weekend was the nighttime kayaking trip to Mosquito Bay (there were no mosquitos at all), which is said to be the greatest example of "bioluminescence" (millions of tiny organisms that light up when disturbed, or splashed) in the world. It absolutely has to be experienced to be believed. Just kicking in the water makes it light up like a fountain. Though the setting at Hix Island House is very private, the entire staff is very approachable and works hard to make guests feel comfortable. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “a relaxation retreat and a place to fall in love again”
Reviews.Author: OdieWhitePlains_NY
Reviews.Content: Because of the virtual zen like ambance and no technology to interrupt you will fall in love with your partner again. You have no choice in the matter. Conversations will abound and sleeping for 12 hours is normal. You will make love more in 4 days than you have in probably 6 months. Oh yeah, the island was great too and the dining were awesome. My favorite was Crows Nest steakhouse.

Reviews.Title: “Entering the 'Zone'....”
Reviews.Author: unwind
Reviews.Content: and I'm not talking about the Zone Diet, which is hopeless with the wonderful homemade bread served each day. I'm refering to unwinding and relaxing to recharge you batteries. I got to this state in about half a day at Hix Island house, a record on any vacation. Innkeepers Mike and Dianne made sure we knew where to go, what to do, and where to eat. Their friendly, relaxed attitude will get you the full lowdown on the island and all it has to offer. The thing is.... it's OK if you don't step a foot out of Hix, enjoy the pool, take a walk, lounge out in the tropical setting and feel the gentle breeze of the Carribean. But what about the BUGS!? It's the tropics and you've got a non-airconditioned room open to the "elements". We'll the breeze took care of the air-conditioning part. It was incredibly rejuvenating not to be in a hotel with the air-conditioning pumping away all night. The bugs were "on vacation". I don't know if it's the breeze, or the dry season but they didn't pose a problem. I came fully prepared to douse myself with chemicals but in the end the cans of spray stayed on the shelf. Ok so where's the bad part? I hate reading reviews where people just keep gushing on and on, you know there must be something they're not telling you. We'll first if you rent a vehicle, make sure it's a high clearance "Jeep like" car. A quick shower can turn the roads into large puddles (if you asked Mike and Dianne they would have told you about this). It's fun if you have a Jeep but not so great if you get stuck in you Neon. Next even if you have a Jeep it's not a great idea to go exploring on a path in the jungle that no one has been down in the last 10 years. It might just... end and then you've got an interesting multi-point turn (speaking from experience). Also the scratches on the vehicle might be a problem when you return it to the rent-a-car place (errr... what scratches?) Last, Mike and Dianne will tell you about all the nice restaurants on the island. It's surprising how many there are. You should go visit every one of them if you get into your "zone" running or exercising. If you got into you zone lounging then don't be surprised about the extra bagage you're carrying on your way back. Last, don't miss the bio-bay on a moonless night, it's an out of this world experience!

Reviews.Title: “It's raining in our living room...!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: ...and we loved it! Fresh island breezes, the smell of tropical rain, and spectacular sunrises...all without leaving your bed! Lizards on the ceiling, fresh fruit in the kitchen, and great homemede bread every day. Who could ask for more? The architecture is refreshingly simple, yet in perfect balance with it's surroundings. Shower in the sunshine and dry off in the morning breeze. Frogs calling at night, roosters in the morning. It really is the ideal combination of a luxury hotel & camping. The staff is exceptional. They really help make the most of your visit. The pool is paradise. Don't cut your stay short or you'll be sorry!

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Retreat”
Reviews.Author: Novasurf
Reviews.Content: Beautiful layout. Comfortable and seductive. We stayed in loft five, which had spectacular views. Michael and Diane are great hosts who pay attention to detail without being overbearing. We were supplied with fresh breads, eggs, coffee and fruits. Great to cook your own breakfast! Super soft shirts to lounge around in. Get familiar with constellations, the night sky is stunning. Highly recommended for the perfect getaway. Vieques is loaded with great restaurants, with both high end and local food. Do take the staff's recs. They were on the money. Will absolutely return.

Reviews.Title: “Birdsong and breezes”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Awaken to birdsong, wild horses neighing in the distance and the Carribean breeze ruffling your crisp, cool sheets. Innkeepers Mike and Diane go the extra mile to make your stay easy and comfortable, and enthusiastically direct you to all the most beautiful beaches, activities and the best restaurants. Relaxation, simplicity, privacy and reconnecting with nature are the embodiment of Hix.

Reviews.Title: “Total Recovery”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We went to Vieques the first time 22 years ago, while visiting a freind stationed at the base. We are puertorricans, and we had traveled extensivelly the islands of the Caribbean. After this visit we had come to the conclusion that this island doesnt have anything to envy from any other island in the Caribbean. Specially if you decide to stay in a place called Hix Island House. This was the best decision we had made, no phone, no T.V., no noise, just nature and friendly staff. It is what I call beach luxury. Simple high tec architecture , no frills, outside showers, confortable beds, well planned design with cross ventilation, high ceilings, wonderful kitchens which include the supplies for a good breakfast, a real nice pool, and a very attentive staff. What else can you ask for?!?! We definitely recommend this place if you are in a need for relaxation and an absortion of nature. The island had become something we hope the natives will be able maintain:chic casual beach life. Good luck to all.

Reviews.Title: “Simplicity with just the right amount of help”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: HIH was great. I appreciated everything about this hotel. The rooms are spectacular -- outside shower (but private), sparse and clean furnishings, great bread and food in the fridge, nightshirts made from egyptian cotton, high quality towels and linens. The kitchen had everything we needed to make dinner and used the Zee Store and the Green Store down the road to supplement what they gave us in the room. The grounds are beautiful, not manicured to give a natural feel. The environmentally friendly practices made us feel better about burning all that jet fuel on the way to and from Boston. Take a few Yoga classes and GET A MASSAGE FROM CHRISTINE! I had 2 and they were fabulous! Listening to the wind in the palms outside our room during a generously long massage was heavenly. Brenda at the front desk was so accomodating, she made suggestions and reservations for us the entire week. She is great. We enjoyed the food at Medina Luna the most, but the fun ambiance of Chez Shack on Reagee night was cool. It was also nice to be able to walk to dinner. Tapas at BBH was also very good. But of course the beaches were the best way to spend the day. We went to all the beaches on the way out to Blue beach and enjoyed the all for different reasons. Some were wavy and good for body surfing. Others were easy to swim and fun to snorkle. The one regret we had was that we didn't go to Green Beach with snorkling equiptment. We waited until the last day to go there and found it to be the best beach for potential cool fish sightings. Lots of nice boats to look at from mainland PR. Some people told us not to tell anyone about beautiful Vieques, but we are spreading the word. I am sure the local people and businesses would appreciate the tourists. I just hope the island finds a way to maintain its natural beauty and not become another all inclusive haven. Vieques is too special for that. Go, relax and enjoy a wonderful hotel and island.

Reviews.Title: “Hix is a Bit of Heaven”
Reviews.Author: beachloverGlenRock
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a wonderful relaxing week at THE HIX ISLAND HOUSE on Vieques, Puerto Rico. We had read about the resort in the NYTIMES and were facinated by the ecology-minded ideas that went into the planning of this peaceful place. The three guest buildings do indeed blend into the land. They are built with large open areas which face the east. As you rest in your bed, you are bathed in moonlight at night and sunlight by day. The showers are placed so that the run-off waters the beautiful natural foliage of the property. The spacious interiors are simple and clean, and equipped with comfortable furniture and the loveliest of linens. Much of the furniture is handmade by John Hix! We were greeted by Diane, Brenda and Michael. They welcomed us with great warmth and gave us the low-down on all the nice places to eat and interesting things to do. Brenda made reservations for us immediately at the popular restaurants and the Biobay. We enjoyed our week immensely. The weather was perfect. We visited many beaches and did some wonderful snorkeling. The local food was delicious and innovative. The visit to Biobay and the swim with the tiny sparkling plankton was an experience we will never forget. There was not time in a week to see all we wanted to see so we will be back next February!

Reviews.Title: “Enchanted retreat on an enchanted island”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at Hix Island House. The feeling of sleeping outdoors is positively addicting. It's very relaxing to make breakfast and sit right outside your room with a cup of coffee while the jungle wakes around you. The hotel has a fun, easy vibe and there's a very cool dog named Porter who's really friendly and ready to play anytime you are! Don't miss meeting him if you visit. Managers Diane and Michael were really enthusiastic about the island's good restaurants and made reservations for each one. Every day someone was always available to help with beach recommendations, where to buy groceries and how to make the most of a stay on this small island.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Relaxation”
Reviews.Author: Finley39
Reviews.Content: Although we didn't stay at the HIH because of availability and price, I did get a chance to walk around the property and take a Yoga class. The Yoga class is excellant, $15, and meets every A.M. I don't do yoga on a regular basis at home but felt very comfortable doing it at HIH and was refreshed for the rest of the day. The setting is beautiful and you should definitely try it whether you're a yoga enthusiast or just an "amateur". They allow tours of the property from 11 a.m. to noon but the rooms were occupied or being cleaned so we didn't get to go in one. Everything looked really nice but I'm not sure if I'd want to pay those prices for any room on the island after staying at Hector's by the Sea for $165/night which was the most perfect place on earth!

Reviews.Title: “A dream come true”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I could not have asked for a more perfect stay. The staff, the rooms, the setting were perfect. I hate to give this secret away but Hix Island House rocks!!!

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular stay at the Hix Island House”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was taken to the Hix Island House on Vieques as a surprise birthday gift. It was quite wonderful. As a fan of contemporary architecture, I loved what John Hix has done with the structures. As a fan of small hotels that respect their physical locations, I admired that John and his wife, Neeva Gayle, have created a retreat that mirrors the casual esthetic that is Vieques and speaks to the beauty that is this island. Diane and Michael, who manage the daily operations, were most generous with their recommendations of things to do and helped with all the arrangements that we needed. All in all, everyone went out of their way to make us feel at home -- and we did. The experience was so good that upon departure we booked our return visit for next year. Our return to Hix Island House will be something that we eagerly look forward to in the months ahead. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful, simple, peaceful rugged luxury”
Reviews.Author: mamafood
Reviews.Content: The perfect place to get away from it all. Clean, simple and comfortable setting in paradise. peace and non intrusion is the motto. And eco friendly to boot. what more could you ask for. It's my new home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “WOW! What a graet place”
Reviews.Author: NewOrleansBill
Reviews.Content: Wow! Is all I can say. This place is fantastic. Visually stunning. The Achitecture is beautiful. The surroundings were peaceful and relaxing. The Managers, a wonderful couple Mike & Diane were the perfect hosts. They were attentive to all of our needs and very informative about the island. Their reccomendations for restaurants and attractions were right on. The island itself is beautiful. The people are very friendly. After a week you feel like a resident. This is a place that everyone should try at least once. Of course when you stay there you will want to return agian and again.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelieveable”
Reviews.Author: ChelseaNY
Reviews.Content: The website for this place doesn't begin to show how cool it is. I can see why people say it's not for everyone, but it was perfect for us. If you can appreciate modern, sort of minimalist design, then you will love it. It's all concrete, yet totally comfortable. The fact that it's open to the elements isn't as much of a factor as I would have thought. There were a few lizards on the walls, but we loved them! The open "window" was incredible - see the attached photo of our sunset view. The loft was absolutely huge and beautiful. You don't have the usual hotel amenities, but it was great having a fully-equipped kitchen, because we got tired of going to mediocre but expensive restaurants. (Tropical Baby was good but suffered from a gross burned oil smell; Media Luna was good but just not great for the money.) It didn't bother us at all being a few miles from the beach. No matter where you stay, you have to drive to the good beaches anyway. We loved Red Beach, even though it was a bit more crowded - great waves for bodysurfing. Blue Beach and Navio were nice, too. Didn't make it to Green Beach, but we did snorkel with Abe at Mosquito Pier, and saw a barracuda! A note about rental cars - I wouldn't rent from Marco's again. We had a very frustrating experience trying to switch cars when ours wasn't working. We went back there five times and he was never open - during regular business hours. I think there must be more reputable places. After staying at Hix, I can't imagine staying anywhere else on Vieques.

Reviews.Title: “Hix Island House- Must See to Believe!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First of all, Hix Island House is simply beautiful! My Amaris and I arrived at Hix Island House on September 10, 2005 and were amazed to find two semi-wild horses grazing right behind the office! Upon our arrival, Kurt and Christianna, the property managers, gave us a brief tour leading back to Casa Triangular Matisse Unit, which is where we had the honor of spending two nights. When we walked in the unit, there was fresh baked bread and a refrigerator full of eggs, milk, juice, cereal, butter and COFFEE!!! This place has it all! After we finished checking out all the features of this wonderful room, I took the wife to see the BioBay. The BioBay alone is enough reason to visit Vieques and stay at the Hix Island House. Kurt gave me excellent directions to the place. When we got back, it rained, which was absolutely beautiful and wonderful, considering there are no windows or doors in the unit. We sat back and watched the beautiful night sky as the clouds passed and revealed a night sky that would make any city slicker move to Puerto Rico. After the storm, we went up to the roof and relaxed as we tried to guess all the constellations. When it was time to sleep, we simply surrounded the bed with the mosquito net and slept like never before. So peaceful! The second day we rode around the entire island to visit the beaches and some see some historical sites, like the Masonic Temple in Gringo Beach. Upon our arrival back at Hix, Christianna met us and gave us a tour of all the units, as we had one of two rooms that was actually occupied. I actually got the idea from one of the reviews I read here (THANKS)! Christianna showed us all the rooms, plus she showed us the solar panels used for heating, and the rain water cistern they use to produce their own water! We saw 11 of the 13 units, as we had one and one was rented. If I had the chance, I would take my wife back and spend one night in each unit. They all have a different feel, but are all unlike any room you have ever visited!!! I can go on and on about how wonderful Hix Island House really is. I could type for days about how professional and gracious our hosts, Kurt and Christianna were. So to save you from reading a book about how much me and my wife loved this place and how I would recommend this place to every person I know, I will just say this, HIX ISLAND HOUSE IS [--] AWESOME!!! Sorry Kurt and Christianna, I had to show SOME emotion! You two are the best property managers I have ever had the opportunity of meeting. I pray our paths cross again, so I can thank you again for a wonderful honeymoon/vacation! Please tell Nanna, the resident pet/property manager we miss her! Like I said in the Guest book, "WE WILL BE BACK!!!" Douglas Family

Reviews.Title: “like camping for city folk”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Hix was just stunning and wonderful, exactly what we were hoping for and more. Christianna even gave us (3 girls) two rooms for the price of one, because we'd messed up our booking times. The rooms were so beautiful, and being completely open to the elements, entirely unlike any hotel I've ever experienced. I will never forget the experience of showering under a night sky full of stars. We fixed up the best meals with the kitchens and the lack of tv/radio/phone gave us a real chance to simply rest quietly and reflect. We spent every morning first at the lovely pool (so nice to swim in non-chlorinated water!), and then every afternoon discovering our own new perfect private beach. Thanks again for such a lovely experience.

Reviews.Title: “A 5 Star Experience”
Reviews.Author: CarolBrooklyn_NY
Reviews.Content: Go to Hixislandhouse and reserve a time for an amazing vacation experience. This is the place. Architecturally sensitive to the environment. 5 star treatment for guests. Lovely hosts. Great ammenities. You'll love the trip. We're going back as soon as we can.

Reviews.Title: “Pure Zen”
Reviews.Author: LuleNY
Reviews.Content: When me and my boyfriend found the Hix House on the internet we booked our room immediately. The pictures of the place sold us. Upon actually getting there I realized that while the photographs were gorgeous, they could'nt do the place justice. The Hix Island house is pure zen. You could'nt be closer to nature. The stunning views and the privacy and seclusion of the lofts were just healing and so peaceful. Aside from the everything else the people that work there were equally as beautiful and so helpful. I highly reccomend this place and have not been able to stop talking about it.

Reviews.Title: “Hix Island House gives back to you”
Reviews.Author: JaimeTorres
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to HIH for a 3 day/2 Nite stay in the middle of the week looking for a romantic get way. We found that and more. The architecture was inspiring, the feel of the place made us feel like love making and the service and attitude of the staff was great. This place is very special and certainly not cheap but we felt energized just by being there. Hix Island House was a fantastic experience for us. Vieques is amazing, the beaches spectacular, tons of restaurants and great vibe all around. We recommend it if you are looking for private and romantic destination and not for hotel luxuries. Not the place if you are on budget.

Reviews.Title: “Camping in style”
Reviews.Author: madam_bomb
Reviews.Content: Hix House is great. The resort is set atop the hill with the buildings facing east/west. This gives you great morning views for most of the lower buildings, although the higher original building I think has better sunset views. The pool is beautiful and the lack of chlorine is refreshing. The birds and lizards around are great natural interest. The large amount of roosters on the island can be annoying (they don't just crow at dawn). The service was helpful, setting up tours and restaurant reservations. The island is definitely for outdoorsy people who don't just want to shop and plop and as you must drive, you'll have to be used to narrow winding, sometimes rough roads. The snorkeling was great especially around the island at Blue Beach and the rocks off of Green Beach (which isn't a "relaxing" beach, it's more for snorkeling or swimming). And the bio-bay is just mind-blowing. Take the Kayak tour with Abe. He's great. As far as restaurants go: La Sirena is a joke of bad management and despite the good tamales it's only worth getting a beer or watching the theatre of the owner fighting with her help. Bili is quite good but a little pricey for what it is. The Tiki Hut sandwich shop is good for breakfast but the sandwiches are a bit strange (the owner was very nice and let us get food just before he closed). Bananas had such bad taste in music (Britney Spears, etc.), it seemed it was only for the culturally challenged. Uvas in Isabel is by far the best hands down despite the price; service, food and the patio setting (don't eat inside it's nice but the patio is great). Michaels deli at Bravo! isn't worth the trip, just average and overpriced for the effort and what's up with the gourmet deli business plan? Why not a real restaurant? And finally, the highlight, Tropical Baby in Isabel. Great brunch and apparently a good dinner. If you're looking for a good supermarket to buy food for the room . . . good luck, we couldn't find it. People kept pointing us to it, but as far as we could tell we were either lost or there really wasn't a supermarket. We were in loft five and the only drawback was the sun streaming in at dawn. If you're an early riser (unlike myself) then you'd love this loft. Overall Vieques is a great place to visit, resembling a typical Mexican town (or rather two towns Isabel II and Esperanza) and offers great outdoor fun.

Reviews.Title: “Exotic but not luxurious”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have to agree with the first review that staying at the HIH is ALOT like camping. If you do not enjoy being outside, need air conditioning or hate bugs, you will most likely not be comfortable there. We went in the off season, so it was very wet - nothing ever dried out completely. We stayed at HIH for 3 nights, which was enough - although we're very glad to have experienced it and will do so again in the future. The grounds and architecture are minimally invasive (very hidden) and fabulous. It's not manicured landscaping like you would find over at the Wyndam, but what would be there naturally. Beautiful. The pool area is stunning, and the water feels very clean (low chemical pool). Although we stayed on the top floor of Casa Rectangular during a booked memorial day weekend (according to innkeepers) we rarely saw or heard another person. The open floorplan gave views of the coast over the tree tops, and the nights were amazingly starry and peaceful. That same open floorplan lets the sun come glaring in EARLY (5:30 - 6 am) - so if you like to sleep late on vacation it's going to be difficult. There is no maid service, but whenever you request something it's there. The coffee is good, the bread somewhat tasty but a little mushy (maybe its the rainy season again). Nothing on Vieques is local (ie: fruit), so expect your basic apple and orange combo flown in from mainland PR. As for the luxury linens/furniture - we had a couple of Frette towels and I think the bedspread was from Ikea. We could care less what kind of linens are provided (again this was not luxury), or furniture - but if it's advertised as such then people expect it to be so. Also we had one very uncomfortable lounge chair made from plywood and a broken plastic armchair - so to sit together we had to perch on the balcony. The innkeepers (Kurt and Christianne) are helpful and very interesting to talk with. Being from over-developed Florida we appreciate what John Hix has created - an attempt to be minimally invasive and environmentally conscious. Overall we would stay at HIH again not expecting luxury, but expecting a quiet, relaxing "experience."

Reviews.Title: “Like camping - only better”
Reviews.Author: milytaylor
Reviews.Content: First of all, if you don't like to camp, you won't like Hix Island House. The rooms are open which means: no lights after dark and no leaving food lying around. I love camping so I didn't have any problems. In fact, it's better because you didn't have to worry about the tents collapsing and you have a constant supply of hot water. :) I just got back from my trip and I miss Hix already. The frogs, called coquis (co-keys), will serenade you to sleep. The rains will lull you into peacefulness. The sun and the roosters will signal the new day. The views are breath-taking. The pool divine. I never once wished for a TV, AC, or DVD. (not included in the room) I brought my own radio/alarm clock. (No clocks in room either.) The room also doesn't have a phone but there is one phone at the main office. I went in off-season, so this may not be true all year around. The island pretty much shuts down at 9 - 10. Bars don't stay open late and there's no place to dance and congregate. Vieques is an island to get away from it all. Don't expect coffee shops, ice cream stands, or bookstores. I found two chains - Directv and the USPS. If that isn't your cup of tea and you need your TV, DVD, AM/FM, then maybe Hix isn't the place for you. Being a single female traveler, I never once felt threatened during my stay at Hix, Vieques, or San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “A Unique and Relaxing Vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Hix Island House was one of the most relaxing vacations I have been on. I had done my homework and knew quite a bit about the resort before I arrived. However, for me, it exceeded my expectations! This is a beautiful place high in the hills. Beautiful tradewinds meant very few bugs while we were there - I only got one mosquito bite during my entire stay in Vieques. Our room was large and spacious and wonderful. It was as open as they described - we had a large patio that was completely open to the outside (there is a metal grate if that makes you more comfortable at night) A ceiling fan made our nights comfortable and we never ever noticed the lack of air conditioning. The openness of our room (missing the fourth wall as we were on the ground floor) made it completely unnecessary. At the same time we were never cold either. The kitchen contained all the utensils, plates and things we required (paper towel, etc). Neeva's potato bread is excellent and was still warm and wrapped in a linen towel when we arrived. A fruit bowl was also inviting when we checked in. We love to cook and it was wonderful to have a spacious area to prepare our own snacks and meals. Grocery shops are just a short drive away. The reception desk and hostesses were incredibly helpful with restaurant recommendations, directions, bookings, everything. A yoga class that I did while I was there was just that - a real yoga class where people from outside the place came to practice. Nightimes were incredible - beautiful star watching, especially from the lounge chairs that we had. One reviewer from last year felt the location was not convenient. Everyone is entitled to their own opinion. In my opinion, a car is essential for visiting Vieques. I can't imagine anyone coming to Vieques without one. We rented a Honda Element and found we were close to everything on the island. After a week of driving around from the Hix Island House, our gas bill was $14US. I think the location is central and perfect. Part of our experience was feeling as if the place was our home. And we truly did. We enjoyed washing our own dishes and making our bed. If we needed anything, we simply asked reception and it was done. Vieques was a wonderful place for peace and quiet. Most nights we 'hung out' watching the stars or reading. We had a truly wonderful meal at Cafe Media Luna one night - the tasting menu is fantastic. Another highly regarded restaurant Chez Shack is just at the end of the street (walking distance) I will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “It is like a dream....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have never experienced such a relaxing holiday as our few days at Hix Island House and the wonderful little island of Vieques. Vieques was a refreshing change from the other Caribbean islands we have visited, in that there was never a lineup experienced, security concerns were rarely if ever present, the beaches were incredible, and the restaurants, surprisingly for such a small place, were of exceptional quality and variety. In response to this setting, John and Neeva Gayle Hix have created the perfect complement. Imagine sleeping in a shell with an 18' wide opening to the softest breezes imaginable at your feet, and waking to the sun gently rising over the Caribbean each morning and illuminating your studio in a warm glow. The achievement of the architecture is that you have a very immediate connection to the natural environment (ocean breezes, sun and shadow, sounds of birds and coqui), yet are protected from the heat of the sun and the night-time rain showers, and can regulate it very easily by manipulating the windowless openings to the exterior. The connection between interior and exterior is often vague - living spaces that project unimpeded to the open sky, showers for each suite that are either open directly to the view or the sky or both, outdoor dining courtyards protected from the wind... The minimal, stongly geometric forms of the buildings magnify the beauty of the natural surroundings and very successfully capture the spirit of the climate. The grounds are a clever combination of wild trees and plants, with shots of colour or form presented by flowering vines and dramatic tall grasses, all orchestrated to provide privacy for the guests and a wonderful ambiance similar to ancient ruins in a jungle. One of the best discoveries is the award-winning swimming pool, with its copper-treated water and view over the hills to the ocean. The hospitality of the owners and staff were excellent, with a very well stocked refrigerator upon arrival, fresh-baked bread (which should be available for export!) and yoga lessons on site, and an eagerness to assure that guests make the most of their stay on the island by readily recommending interesting sites and good restaurants. Hix Island House is definitely a 'design destination', and in conjunction with the interests of its owners in environmental conservation, is also an experience unlike any others we know of. If you enjoy adventure and good design, we highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A dream honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hix Island House was provided a spectacular finale to my honeymoon. Not only was the architecture fabulous, but the rooms felt private while being extremely airy and open. They have a very sensual quality to them - the rooms and the setting - the (extremely private) outdoor showers. The amenities were top-notch (fabulous pool with an awesome view), appliances and utensils were uptodate and spotless and all the details were attended to. Lastly, Kurt and Christianna who operate the place were prompt, responsive and extremely helpful. Go there at the right time of the year and you will also bump into the delightful proprieters : Neeva Gayle and John Hix.

Reviews.Title: “You don't want to miss!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We loved our trip to Vieques, Puerto Rico and our stay at Hix Island House. It truly is a place to go, relax and enjoy the beautiful surroundings around you. The archertecture of the buildings is brilliant. The view from our bed was the best seat in the house for a gorgous tropical storm that greeted us our first evening during our stay at HixIisland House. The gentle breezes and the warmth of the Carribean is a place you don't want to miss! There are so many unique characteristics and one of our favorite features was the outdoor shower. What a feeling to shower under the stars, but still in complete privacy. We enjoyed our time at HIH and will never forget it's beauty:)

Reviews.Title: “Nature in control....not out of control.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: John and Neeva Gayle have set the stage for those who seek serenity and calm in the center of Nature's wonders. John's unique architectural style allows you to observe the natural setting without feeling you're the intrusion. The Caribbean winds play with his forms like delicate fingers on a fine string instrument with hummingbirds, King birds and cukoos chiming in as the chorus. Neeva Gayle's refined aesthetic sets the mood in each of the lofts and her homemade breads reinforce the comfort zone. She always makes you feel you're at home and goes the extra mile to make the holiday perfect. One visit to HIH and the unpretentious island of Viequez will reward you with desire to do it again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but buggy!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hix Island house was a gorgeous, remote paradise--the entire place was full but we did not see or hear a single person while we were there. The scenery and service was unbeatable!! Sunsets and sunrise were gorgeous. The downside: It was a little "too close" to nature for us and we would have preferred some screens on the windows! However, if you don't mind being right in the midst of nature and its surroundings it is the place to be!
